Data Analyst

Onsite Locations: Tampa, Florida, Colorado Springs, CO, Fort Walton Beach, Florida, Virginia Beach, VA

Homestead, Florida, Fayetteville, NC, Jacksonville, NC

Clearance: TS and eligible for SCI

Data Driven. People Centered.

Elder Research Inc. is a Data Science consulting firm specialized in providing analytic solutions to clients in Commercial and Government industries. Providing analytic solutions to hundreds of companies across numerous industries, our team enjoys a great variety in the type of work they do and exposure to a wide range of techniques and tools.

We are trusted advisors to our clients, building lasting relationships and partnering as preferred analytics providers. We use a variety of programming languages and tools to create analytic solutions, often fitting within our clients’ environment and needs.

Join our team and find great opportunities to hone your analytic skills, work on complex problems with amazing teammates, and gain valuable analytics consulting experience.

Summary of Position:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our team! In this role, you will use technology to mine complex, voluminous, and different varieties of data from various sources and platforms in order to collect, analyze, and compile data to meet customer needs.


Required Skills:

Experience with: Python, JavaScript, R, C/C++, SQL, Go, Flask, React, SQLAlchemy, CI/CD
Ability to Analyze local, national, and global trends to identify new sources of data and methods to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting.
Ability to determine technical issues and remove corrupted data & fix coding errors and related issues.
Work collaboratively with Intelligence and Data analysis teams to produce qualitative and quantitative data analysis that supports Intelligence products and processes.
Experience Building data solutions, tools, and capabilities to enable self-service frameworks and/or automation for data consumers to monitor, extract, and report on data.
Familiarity with IDST members and GOV leadership to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data management strategies for the enterprise to improve the quality and usability of data.
Use statistical tools to identify, analyze, and interpret, patterns and trends in complex data sets.


About Elder Research, Inc

Elder Research is a fast-growing consulting firm specializing in predictive analytics. Being in the data science business over 20 years, we pride ourselves in our ability to find creative and innovative solutions to real world problems. We work hard to provide the best value to our clients and allow each person to contribute their ideas and put their skills to use immediately.

Our team members are passionate, curious, life-long learners. We value humility, servant-leadership, teamwork, and integrity. We seek to serve our clients and our teammates to the best of our abilities. In keeping with our entrepreneurial spirit, we want candidates who are self-motivated with an innate curiosity and strong teamwork.

Elder Research believes in continuous learning; each week the entire company attends a “Tech Talk” followed by an office lunch. Elder Research provides a supportive work environment with established parental, bereavement, and PTO policies. By prioritizing a healthy work-life balance - with reasonable hours, solid pay, low travel, and extremely flexible time off - Elder Research enables and encourages its employees to serve others.

Elder Research, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Elder Research is a Government contractor and our positions require US Citizenship.

Exceptional Excel skills including Power Pivot and Power Query
Knowledge of database design principles and data modelling including database methodologies such as flat files, indexed flat files, and relational databases

Advanced problem-solving and decision-making skills coupled with strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Strong time management and organizational skills; ability to juggle multiple projects while delivering work on time and of high quality

Development Management Office (DMO) Overview
The Development Management Office (DMO) supports Design Engineering, New Site Development, Construction, Innovation, Sustainability and Project Controls teams within the Vantage Development & Engineering (D&E) global organization. The DMO develops standards for business process, documents these standards within an automated project management framework and manages dashboard-based reporting for the Development & Engineering organization.
The DMO is responsible for design, documentation and management of the business process flow coordinating the activities of D&E and other teams along the way. The DMO ensures that key stakeholders are engaged in the decision-making process to align project conditions, design goals and schedule targets to corporate goals. The DMO works to empower each member across teams to drive high- impact decisions and even more impactful results.
Position Overview
Vantage is looking for a mid-level Data Analyst who is strong in analytics to handle projects, create dashboards, report & analyze data to drive project management excellence. As a member of the DMO team, the Development Data Analyst collaborates with system and data owners to develop Vantage’s dashboarding capability.
They will transform data into information using visualization tools and techniques to support business decision making. The Development Data Analyst will extract meaningful insights, ideas and opportunities using strategic thinking. They will support users by establishing performance reporting standards requiring in depth evaluation and skill to scale. Collaborating with other business reporting SMEs, they will drive consistency and contribute to the BI strategy and roadmap. You will support customer and internal audit, compliance/ad-hoc requests by creating dashboards, reports and analyses as required.
Duties
Build reporting capabilities via data visualization system(s) with appropriate cost / benefit
Translate and communicate business and operational results where findings are presented in standard, graphical views that enable users to dynamically adjust
Continually adjust data visualization solutions and outputs to support changing business needs
Query, scrub & model data to gain more in-depth insight into relationships and trends
Provide counsel and leadership on visualization improvements
Interpret, carefully evaluate, and identify actionable insights from performance reporting results
Support users with reporting and collaboration tools
Build reporting capabilities via data visualization system(s) with appropriate cost / benefit
Translate and communicate business and operational results where findings are presented in standard, graphical views that enable users to dynamically adjust
Continually adjust data visualization solutions and outputs to support changing business needs
Provide counsel and leadership on visualization improvements
Understand technical problems and solutions in relation to the current, as well as the future business environment
Job Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Information Technology/Data Science) or Engineering, Construction Management or, equivalent experience
4-7 years of Business Intelligence and Data Visualization and Management
Experience in an EPC, client or construction organization is preferable but not essential
Statistics & analytics (descriptive, diagnostic & predictive)
Data Visualization - MS Power BI, Tableau
Other Tools – Integration with Procore, Oracle Primavera (P6), MS 360 Suite, Sharepoint skills
Effective personal and social skills, including the ability to influence others, drive new capabilities, and bring new ways of thinking into the company
Self-motivated, change catalyst
Strong organizational and communication skills, excellent problem-solving, logical process thinking and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and chip in quickly is required
Genuine drive and motivation with a “can do” attitude. Results-driven and committed to the future growth of Vantage, committed to our customer’s success and to your own career growth
Travel is expected to be less than 5%, but may increase over time as the business evolves

A successful candidate will need to have experience of Qlik development including experience in an enterprise level environment. They will have an understanding of data and data warehousing and experience in end-to-end implementation of projects. A strong working knowledge of ETL processing and data transformation techniques. Must be able to analyze and interpret business requirements to identify technical solutions. We are looking for a hands-on professional who is self-driven, creative and able to lead, train, mentor and change gears quickly when needed.
Responsibilities:
Provide accurate, timely, and insightful information and analytics to the business utilizing Qlik and other Business Intelligence solutions
Communicate directly with JBS Fed Prepared Foods business leadership to scope problem statements, provide estimated timelines for solution builds and routine updates throughout project build
Build data visualization dashboards utilizing Qlik platform to provide solutions to problem statements established by the business
Provide working knowledge of data flow between JBS operational systems.
Generate routine (daily, weekly, monthly) reporting of business operational performance in the most efficient manner possible
Collaborate with JBS IT while designing new reporting solutions, automating current reporting solutions, or trouble shooting report issues
Other duties as assigned


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Finance, Agribusiness, Computer Science, Business Analysis or relevant field required
3 or more years’ hands-on business experience developing in Qlik products
Experience in QlikView, Qlik Sense, or relevant data visualization software is required
Advanced skills in Excel required
Working knowledge of SQL or other programming language
Detail-oriented with strong organizational, analytical and communication skills.
Able to comprehend and translate complex and advanced functional, technical and business requirements into executable architectural designs.
Meat industry experience is a major plus
Can perform the functions of the job with or without a reasonable accommodation

Job Title: Senior Human Resources Analyst
Salary Range: $70,000 - $85,000 annually
Type: Exempt, Salaried
Location: Denver, Colorado (865 N Albion Street, Denver, CO 80220)

Position Objective
The Senior Human Resources (HR) Analyst will be responsible for leveraging data-driven insights to support strategic decision making in various areas such as people analytics, compensation, employee engagement and performance management. This role requires a strong understanding of HR processes, excellent quantitative skills and the ability to translate data into stories and actionable recommendations for the HR team and senior leaders of the company.

Major Functions
Compensation Analytics

Identify tool improvements, system automation, and data enhancements.
Perform analysis on different compensation plan changes to understand the impact on the business and consult leadership on the evolution of our compensation plan.
Own the execution of Schwazze’s compensation process including management of compensation bands, market pricing strategy and annual compensation planning.
Partner with HR leaders to ensure employees are receiving correct compensation per the terms of their plan.
Interpret and apply understanding of key financial indicators to advance business objectives, using financial analysis to generate and evaluate strategic options and opportunities.
Partner with business leaders on execution of company bonus plans. Help support program design and implementation. Provides analysis and insights to determine effectiveness of the bonus plan (i.e. is the plan resulting in the intended behavioral change(s) and business performance / results).
Completes required state reporting, such as reports and data requests from the Department of Workforce Solutions and the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, Occupational Employment and Wage Statistics (OEWS) program, or other mandatory requests from such agencies.

HRMS Analytics & Project Management

Leads and maintains data integrity efforts across the Schwazze organization within HR systems.
Independently manages HR Technology projects; establishes project timelines and buy-in from all stakeholders.
Document and provide lessons learned analysis to improve the delivery of future projects.
Participate in meetings with management and staff to perform analysis of change requests and/or recommendations and translate into proper business system requirements.
Work with employees in the development of project plans that include analysis of cost, resource allocation, resource requirements, related risk, risk mitigation, and return on investment.
Assist team members with technical issues related to the HR Technology systems by investigating problems and developing detailed suggestions for the resolution of issues.
Coordinate with third-party technical resources with regards to project development, implementation, and/or issues
Define, analyze, and evaluate existing business functions and processes, as well as make recommendations to management on opportunities for process improvements.

Employee Engagement Analytics

Lead the analysis of employee engagement survey data, extracting actionable insights and trends to support the development of targeted action plans.
Utilize survey data to create individual site-specific dashboards that highlight engagement metrics, enabling managers and teams to track progress and make informed decisions.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify key insights based on location, department and managerial levels, providing actionable recommendations to improve engagement levels.
Collaborate with HR partners and business leaders to interpret survey results, identify areas for improvement and develop strategies to enhance employee engagement across the organization.
Work closely with managers to provide guidance and support in understanding their teams survey data, fostering a data-driven approach to improving employee satisfaction and productivity.
Implement methodologies to measure the effectiveness of action plans derived from survey insights, continuously evaluating and refining strategies based on data-driven feedback.

Performance Management Analytics

Supports performance management dashboards, reports and analytics.
Provides data insights and support in preparation for calibration meetings.
Utilizes HR systems to share insights from Performance Management cycles and ensures data integrity between systems is accurate.

Talent Management Analytics

Supports talent management dashboards, reports and analytics.
Provides data insights and support in preparation for succession planning meetings and discussions.

Please note that the percentage allocation is a general estimate and may vary based on business needs and priorities.
Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Statistics, Data Analytics, or related field.
Must be at least 21 years of age.
Ability to obtain and maintain an active MED badge in the state of Colorado.
Proven experience (3+ years) working in HR analytics, preferably in roles focused on people analytics, compensation analytics, employee engagement and performance management analytics.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, Power BI, or other statistical software.
Strong analytics skills with the ability to interpret and leverage data for strategic decision making.
Experience with HR Management Systems. Experience with Lattice, UKG a plus.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Knowledge of HR principles and practices, employment laws, and regulations.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at various levels of the organization.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to maintaining data integrity and confidentiality.
Ability to analyze data, interpret insights and provide accurate and appropriate storytelling through presentations to support decision making.

Working Conditions (Schedule, Environment, Travel)

Schedule may vary depending on the needs of the business, including nights, weekends, and holidays.

The Business Strategy Analyst – Deposit Offers is an individual contributor role accountable for insights, analysis, and tactics to plan and measure deposit promotional offer campaigns.
The role will set Deposits’ promotional offer learning agenda, develop recommendations for offer improvements, build business cases and influence the bank planning process to secure investments in Deposit offers. Also be accountable for setting and all leading offer related key performance indicators and key risk indicators to include designing and implementing automated monitoring to ensure compliant execution of offer campaigns (e.g., offer fulfillment dashboards to validate offers operating in line with terms and conditions). Partner closely with multiple partners to include Marketing, Bank Growth Engine, Finance, Product Strategy, and Information Technology. Successful candidates will have significant experience analyzing bank product offer campaigns and building robust financial models, while also having strong technical skills necessary to access, manipulate, and analyze data from disparate data sources.

Uses quantitative and qualitative analysis to provide thought-leadership on evolving industry trends, market developments, USAA’s strategic direction, regulatory environment, and macroeconomic trends for the business unit. Provides insights and information-based context for key stakeholders in the business unit to effectively manage, influence, and impact line of business strategy.

We offer a flexible work environment that requires an individual to be in the office 4 days per week. This position can be based in one of the following locations: San Antonio, TX, Plano, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Colorado Springs, CO, Charlotte, NC, Chesapeake, VA or Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

What you'll do:
Leads discussions with key collaborators to communicate information learned from analyses, provide input into line of business strategy development, and drive and influence business decisions.
Leads integration of the analytic strategy and business strategy.
Leads and oversees efforts to identify key business assumptions and hypotheses around line of business strategy. Continuously refines hypotheses and identifies business questions to explore further.
Develops the analytical framework and blueprint to answer business questions identified in the business portfolio, product, or member experience.
Collaborates with key stakeholders to evaluate and uncover strategic insights related to Profit & Loss performance including Product Strategy, Pricing, Marketing, Sales, Credit Risk, Distribution Channels, and Member Experience.
Applies expert analytical rigor to define outcome measures, improve prioritization, increase agility in decisioning, improve ability to evaluate progress towards business outcomes, and to evaluate risks to strategic goals.
Effectively influences and drives strategic agreement using subject matter expertise and interpersonal and negotiation skills.
Serves as a team lead and provides guidance and on-the-job training to team members.
Ensures risks associated with business activities are effectively identified, measured, monitored, and controlled in accordance with risk and compliance policies and procedures.

What you have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline; OR 4+ years of related experience (in addition to the minimum years of experience required) may be substituted in lieu of degree.
8+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience; OR a minimum of 6+ years of data & analytics or strategy consulting experience and up to 2+ years of progressive functional business relevant experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing etc.) for a total of 8+ years of combined experience; OR Advanced Degree in Business, Science, Finance, Economics or related discipline and 6+ years of experience in data/analytics, strategy consulting or functional business experience within the respective industry of responsibility (i.e. P&C, Bank, Finance, Marketing, etc.).
Experience identifying business needs and leading strategic plans driven by qualitative/quantitative analysis and market insights.
Strong analytical skills with experience using hypotheses-driven problem solving.
Extensive experience leading and performing complex data analysis using various data analytics tools (i.e. Microsoft Excel, Tableau, R, Python).
Experience influencing business decisions.
Experience working with leadership teams to identify key opportunities to develop and enhance business strategy using quantitative and qualitative analytics.

What sets you apart:
5+ years of deposit, credit card or payments product management experience
Significant experience analyzing deposits data, prospect databases, and transactional insights
Demonstrated experience conducting offer based performance analyses with deposit, credit card, or payments products
Strong verbal and written communication skills, especially PowerPoint
US military experience through military service or a military spouse/domestic partner

We are a rapidly growing financial advisory firm focused on transaction and specializing in providing data-centric decisions. Our team consists of finance and accounting experts with a penchant for data science. We are looking for an experienced Analyst Manager to join our Accounting-Finance team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial due diligence, data analytics, accounting analysis, accounting management, and will be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. We provide a healthy work life balance and a sustainable lifestyle so that you can achieve company goals effectively.
What You Will Be Doing
As our Analyst Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the accounting process, including data analysis, creating and implementing accounting management systems, and auditing financial records. You will analyze data, identify patterns and trends, and present and communicate drivers of business performance. You will also provide guidance to the staff and collaborate with the team to ensure accuracy and quality in all aspects of the work.
What You Need for this Position
Bachelors Degree in Accounting or relevant field
4+ years of Financial Due Diligence, data analysis, audit, and transaction services experience
4+ years of accounting, financial analysis, reporting, budgeting, forecasting, and data science experience
Experience interacting with senior leadership on finance matters and analyzing financial transactions
Basic knowledge of accounting and GAAP, finance, plus complementary knowledge of core statistics, programming, or valuation concepts

AUTHENTICITY | EMPOWERMENT | COLLABORATION | PURPOSE

Alterra Mountain Company is a family of 17 iconic year-round resorts, the world's largest heli-skiing operation, and Ikon Pass - the premier ski and snowboard season pass offering access to more than 50 iconic mountain destinations around the world.

Headquartered in Denver, Colorado and born out of a shared love of the mountains and adventure, the company has brought together some of the world's most aspirational brands, including: Steamboat and Winter Park in Colorado; Palisades Tahoe, Mammoth Mountain, June Mountain, Big Bear Mountain Resort and Snow Valley in California; Stratton Mountain and Sugarbush Resort in Vermont; Snowshoe Mountain in West Virginia; Tremblant in Quebec and Blue Mountain in Ontario, Canada; Crystal Mountain in Washington; Schweitzer in Idaho; Deer Valley Resort and Solitude Mountain Resort in Utah; and CMH Heli-Skiing & Summer Adventures in British Columbia. Also included in the portfolio is Alpine Aerotech, a worldwide helicopter support and maintenance service center in British Columbia, Canada, Aspenware, the ski industry leader in technology services and e-commerce, and Ski Butlers, the global leader in ski and snowboard rental delivery.

A career with Alterra Mountain Company is more than what you do today; it's being part of creating a community rooted in the spirit of the mountains, united by a passion for adventure, and celebrating the legendary adventures and enduring memories that mountains bring to everyone.

BESIDES WORKING SOMEWHERE AWESOME, WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Free Ikon Pass for all eligible employees, with additional free skiing + riding privileges across the family of Alterra Mountain Company resorts for all eligible employees and their dependents
Discounted skiing + riding for friends and family of eligible employees across the family of Alterra Mountain Company Resorts
Flexible Time Off (FTO) and Paid Time Off (PTO) policies for eligible employees to rest, relax and recharge
Generous discounts on outdoor gear, apparel, rental cars, etc.
Medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, short term & long-term disability insurance, EAP, HSAs, FSAs, and more
401(k) plan with generous company match
Discounted tuition with partner online university for all Alterra Mountain Company employees to further their education
Paid parental leave of up to 6 weeks for eligible employees
Commuter benefits (Denver employees only)
Flexible/hybrid workplace policy empowering employees to work from home while encouraging regular in-person collaboration in our dog-friendly company headquarters office located in Denver's RiNo Art District neighborhood

For information on Alterra Mountain Company's Social Responsibility work including our Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion actions, please see our webpage at www.alterramtnco.com/social-responsibility. Among other resources, Alterra has Employee Resource Groups to support the BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and people of color), disability, LGBTQIA2S+, and women communities within our workforce.

POSITION SUMMARY

At Alterra, our technology teams do things a bit differently. We don't invent work - we build and deliver technical solutions to meet the needs of the enterprise. We love the work we do and who we do it for - our guests!

As the Senior Business Analyst on the technical product team, you will be responsible for the execution of technical deliverables that drive one of our most critical platforms - AMP, the eCommerce engine for Ikon.

This is a challenging and fast-paced position where responsibilities shift day-to-day, and often hour-by-hour. Don't worry - you'll get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues from all over Alterra along the way.

But we're not just invested in development; we're also invested in people. We know that our overall success is a combined effort, and we therefore strive to provide opportunities for our employees to learn, grow and thrive.

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES & JOB DUTIES

Lead the execution of technical development across multiple projects concurrently
Author user stories with clear and detailed functional/non-functional specifications with solid acceptance criteria
Keep the product backlog full of actionable user stories and development deliverables
Meet with stakeholders to "dig in" and define detailed business requirements
Manage operational activities, such as guest notifications and feature launch plans
Lead the AMP team through all the Agile SCRUM ceremonies
Collaborate with your technical product manager to align on the strategic IT roadmap
Build and maintain project/initiative documentation

QUALIFICATIONS, EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

Required:

5+ years' experience leading engineering teams through the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC)
Strong experience with deconstructing complex business problems into detailed requirements and actionable user stories
Ability to adapt easily to a variety of projects ranging from co-contributor to project lead
Confidence working with engineering and QA teams to design and build enterprise-class platforms
Previous experience managing multiple initiatives that span all lines of business and integrations with other IT platforms
Working knowledge of API integration technologies
Demonstrated experience acting as a mentor to team members and project leaders to educate and assist them with implementing Agile best practices
Practical experience with Agile SCRUM methodology
Motivated self-starter that can lead projects independently, with minimal direction
Experience establishing practices, policies, and partnerships to promote efficiency capabilities for the organization
Understanding of interdependencies between technology, operations, and business needs
Bachelor's degree in a technical field; or equivalent combination of education and experience

Preferred:

Experience facilitating Agile SCRUM ceremonies (daily stand-ups, backlog grooming/refinement, sprint planning, and retrospectives)
An understanding of eCommerce applications
Familiarity with the Ski Industry / Resort operations
Proficiency with Jira, Confluence, Slack, and Figma

Seeking a highly skilled and dynamic Senior Management Analyst to join our team, focusing on financial and operational analytics. In this role, excellent collaboration, facilitation, and relationship-building capabilities will be crucial, as you will be responsible for providing data-driven decision-making support, optimizing business processes, and driving organizational performance. Your financial expertise and analytical capabilities, combined with strong interpersonal abilities, will play a crucial role in guiding strategic planning and resource allocation.
Responsibilities:
Financial Analysis and Forecasting: Collaborate with finance teams to conduct thorough financial analysis, interpret financial statements, and develop accurate and reliable financial forecasts. Provide insights and recommendations to support budget management and financial decision-making.
Operational Performance Optimization: Evaluate existing business processes, identify inefficiencies, and propose data-driven solutions to streamline workflows and enhance overall operational efficiency.
Budget Management: Monitor expenses, track financial performance against predefined targets, and actively participate in budget planning and monitoring.
Capital Project Tracking: Develop and maintain a system for tracking capital projects, including budget allocation, expenditure monitoring, and progress evaluation. Regularly communicate project status and financial performance to stakeholders.
Data Integration and Analysis: Utilize data from various sources to conduct comprehensive analyses, identify trends, and extract actionable insights to inform business strategies.
Decision Support: Collaborate with stakeholders to develop and maintain decision support systems, providing real-time insights into key performance indicators to drive data-driven decision-making.
Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Design and maintain performance monitoring systems to track key metrics and milestones. Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to present findings and recommendations to management.
Data Visualization: Create compelling visual representations of data, including graphs, charts, and interactive dashboards, to effectively communicate complex information to non-technical audiences.
Data Privacy and Compliance: Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and company policies while handling sensitive data. Establish and enforce data governance practices to maintain data security and privacy.
Excellent Interpersonal Abilities: Demonstrate excellent collaboration, facilitation, and relationship-building capabilities to effectively collaborate with various stakeholders. Lead workshops, facilitate meetings, and build strong relationships with cross-functional teams to drive collaboration and support data-driven initiatives.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of emerging trends in data management and analysis techniques, contributing to the continuous improvement of data-related processes within the organization.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS & WORKING CONDITIONS
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in; Business Administration, Public Administration, Finance, or related fields.
Experience:
Three or more years of experience as a Management Analyst, preferably with a track record of successfully delivering financial and operational insights in a fast-paced and data-driven environment.
Demonstrated ability to lead workshops, facilitate meetings, and foster a collaborative environment to drive cross-functional initiatives and achieve organizational objectives.
Tracking of capital projects, ensuring adherence to budgetary constraints and timely completion of milestones.
Successful history of contributing to the continuous improvement of data-related processes, staying informed about emerging trends and best practices in data management and analysis.
Experience in presenting findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders through clear and engaging reports and data visualizations.
Skills:
Strong financial analysis and forecasting skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, Python, or R.
Familiarity with financial modeling techniques and performance metrics.
Ability to interpret complex data and extract actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey findings to stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively, lead workshops, facilitate meetings, and build positive relationships with team members and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet tight deadlines.
As a Management Analyst your skills and experience with excellent collaboration, facilitation, and relationship-building capabilities will be crucial in driving data-driven decision-making and optimizing organizational performance. Your financial expertise and analytical capabilities will enable you to provide valuable insights and support strategic planning efforts. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are passionate about leveraging data to inform decision-making, we welcome your application!
WORKING CONDITIONS
Physical Demands:
Light physical work requiring ability to life a maximum of 25 pounds, including lifting 10 pounds overhead.
Occasional carrying, walking and standing.
Vision to analyze data and read and interpret reports, documents and other written information.
Hand/eye coordination for operation of computer keyboard.
Speech communication and hearing to maintain communication with employees and citizens.
Capable of driving between city supported buildings and to meetings in the Denver metro area as needed.
Work Environment:
Normally works in a clean, comfortable environment.
System support issues may require working outside the office environment and in or around emergency response vehicles.
Requires rotational on-call support status after normal business work hours.
Equipment Used:
Standard business and professional tools and equipment including computers, laptop computers and mobile computing devices.

Business Analyst Role:

As a member of the company’s information technology team, the Business Analyst is skilled in the analysis of business processes and elicitation of requirements from multiple, and sometimes conflicting, business units. The individual in this role is responsible for the project management and/or scrum master responsibilities for assigned projects, taking gathered requirements through development and successful implementation. The Business Analyst works with technical and non-technical teams and must communicate effectively according to the audience. The ideal candidate is comfortable with a high degree of change, deals well with ambiguity, and is capable working in an agile software development environment with strong project management skills.

Essential Functions:

Provide thorough assessments of current-state and future-state business processes to establish technical solutions, cost-benefit analysis, and scope estimations
Gather requirements by conducting process workshops, discovery sessions, and backlog refinement to translate into accurate and meaningful epics, user stories and acceptance criteria
Advise business stakeholders on platform best practices and standard feature adoption by working with technical leads and the Enterprise Solution Architect
Perform role of Scrum Master and/or Project Manager, undertake duties such as leading agile ceremonies, creating project plans, reporting project status across the organization, planning and facilitating end-to-end UAT activities, and creating deployment and cutover plans as needed
Prioritize and track all issues, risks, action items and decisions to resolution, escalating as needed to ensure project success
Build and maintain process and project documentation in Confluence/Box
Facilitate change management in areas affected by development activities
Evaluate system changes for downstream system and/or organizational impact
Develop and maintain productive working relationships with key internal clients and other team members
Maintain state-of-the-art knowledge of related systems and techniques, including evaluation of computer hardware and software, and support research, evaluation, and selection of new system software
Comply with Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) methodology and compliance obligations
Promote and demonstrate the behaviors consistent with CoreSite’s culture and Guiding Principles




Other Duties:

Train on, and support the use of, assigned applications/software, and various reporting systems
Participate in Quality Assurance and Quality Control practices, standards, methodologies, and metrics
Ability to come to speed quickly to understand and use proposed third-party vendor tools
Complete system and process effectiveness audits
Other projects and duties as assigned

Requirements

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

Knowledge of information and systems technology, systems and techniques, computer network systems and various telecommunication systems
Knowledge of MuleSoft or Enterprise Integration Strategies are a plus
Aptitude for quickly learning new applications and operating systems
Use and support developed and purchased business applications
Maintain a persistent focus to perform troubleshooting and problem resolution
Plan and organize work activities to meet deadlines for yourself and teams
Communication skills including communicating at a technical or non-technical level, and the ability to interact with people from all organizational levels
Strong documentation skills
Ability to collect and analyze data to assist in decision-making
Knowledge and experience in various project delivery methodologies and able to apply necessary processes to ensure project success
Strong problem solving (error detection, root cause analysis, error correction), conceptual, analytical, and decision-making skills
Project management skills to manage small to medium-sized projects

Education/Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, information technology or related studies preferred
Three (3) or more years of related experience, which includes at least two (2) or more years of related experience supporting a variety of business software, and two (2) or more years of experience supporting IT with systems implementations as a Business SME or Product Owner.
Experience with Salesforce highly desired
Salesforce certification(s) a plus (Administrator, Business Analyst, Advanced Administrator)

The Data Analyst is responsible for understanding business requirements and designing data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights. They will be responsible for designing data pipelines and infrastructure, developing reports and dashboards, interpreting data, and communicating to technical and non-technical audiences. The individual in this role must be analytical and resourceful, have excellent communication skills, and can work directly with end users and stakeholders.


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Develops professional-quality business intelligence, data visualization, and analytics content in support of OSIS’s strategic priorities, using Power BI and Crystal Reports.
Provide Subject Matter Expertise (SME) support in common functions of the BI technologies including reporting, analytics, analytical processing, data transformation, and data.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements, such as automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Optimizes performance and usability of Power BI reports and dashboards by tuning queries, implementing efficient data models, and applying best practices.
Collaborates with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, translates them into technical specifications, and designs efficient and visually appealing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Provides a high level of internal and external customer service.


REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

BS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience
Minimum 2 years of demonstrated experience developing accurate, effective, and appealing visualizations using Microsoft Power BI.
Knowledge of Power BI application security layer models
Proficient in SQL, T-SQL, and SQL Server Management Studio
Strong Knowledge of DW architecture and ETL frameworks
Understand relational Database concepts, including normalization and query optimization


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

Experience using Azure Data Factory (ADF), building and managing data pipelines to enable the flow of data into an Azure-based Enterprise Data Platform
Experience developing reports with Crystal Reports
Familiar with Azure DevOps, Agile development, and Git

Job Title: Business Analyst (COBRA or MPM Cost Tool)
Job Description:
Description:

Job Title: Business Analyst (COBRA or MPM Cost Tool)

Job Code: SAS20232009-106296

Job Location: Colorado Springs, CO

Job Description:

Manage complex projects or processes with general oversight. Communicate within and outside of own function to gain cooperation on operational processes, practices, and procedures. Make moderate to substantial improvements to systems and processes. Opportunities for problem solving and innovation are complex and may require comprehensive information gathering, analysis, and investigation to understand the problem. Problems typically involve consideration of multiple issues, job areas, or specialties. Problems are generally solved through creative solutions, drawing from prior experience, and in-depth analysis of issues. Contribute to achievement of departmental goals and operating plans with direct impact on the departmental results needed to maintain all performance measurement data (baseline, performance, actual costs, and estimates to complete) for the Deltek MPM cost tool (Transitioning to COBRA) and associated wInsight and Empower databases, integrating with the Microsoft Project program planning tool and the PeopleSoft accounting system in order to comply with ANSI/EIA-748 Earned Value (EV) requirements for the MOSSAIC contract.

Essential Functions:

Resolve all EV data-related issues in a timely manner
Research and respond to customer requests for additional data and analysis
Document work, processes, and training
Perform MPM and COBRA cost tool system administration for the SI1 segment including new program setup, global file (including rate) updates, and program access/security
Perform routine and ad hoc earned value analysis, create reports, and provide EV advice for program management, CAMs (Control Account Managers), planners, and contract administrators
Review and approve/disapprove change control documents (work authorization and change requests)
Administer activity codes linking cost, accounting, and planning tool WBS IDs
Provide peer review and data checking for monthly reports
Integrate new systems (Deltek Cobra, Encore Analytics Empower) as they become available and/or required
Provide data and documentation for external (DCMA, DCAA, ISO) and internal review
Create and maintain accurate records
o Create control account plan reports from the cost tool for initial baselines and changes
o Create IBR artifacts
o Maintain cost tool historical record/history
o Maintain records for all month end data processes (MS Project files, MPM loading files, cost tracking, COD (correction of deficiency) logs, etc.)

Exercise SOX compliance and controls through tracking and controlling program access across SI1 (segment level)
Take project controls from contract to baseline and monthly IPMR on a regular basis
Participate in VAR reviews, analysis, and selection for monthly IPMR submissions
Interface with planners on a regular basis to assure compliance for baseline and program changes

Qualifications:

Must have experience with COBRA Cost Tool or MPM Cost Tool
Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 4 years of prior relevant experience; Or, Graduate Degree and a minimum of 2 years of prior related experience; Or, in lieu of a degree, minimum of 8 years of prior related experience
Experience with pulling and analyzing data from numerous sources
PC skills in MS office, with Word and Excel formats is essential
Ability to work in fast paced environment to meet monthly deadlines for CDRL deliveries

Preferred Additional Skills:

Clearance if desired or ability to obtain a clearance
Experience with wInsight and/or Empower analysis tools

MIRACORP Inc., is a veteran, woman-owned firm specializing in federal government contract services. One of our competitive advantages is that we provide services to our customers with a standard of excellence that is unmatched. MIRACORP believes our employees are the cornerstone for our success.


Position Summary:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst II to provide federal grant management support for our federal customer to perform tasks not limited to: finance, accounting, information technology, research and analysis, or other program support fields.




Key Responsibilities include:

Works in support of the general management and business operation of the LCA program, as well as Region 8 Leasing Division.
Provides data analysis and research for specific projects related to Novations, File Reviews, Property Tax analysis, Operating Cost Adjustments, and Rent Inquires.
Supports managers and customers on a variety of tasks and projects to meet deadlines.
Continuously exercises discretion and independent judgment on the analysis, planning, and/or implementation of important program initiatives.
Provides basic support of new Business Data Analysts in the form of training, mentoring, and shadowing opportunities.
Ability to cross train over each LCA region to support other teams.
Ability to provide support of national initiatives that the LCA program manages. Such as portfolio wide modifications.

Qualifications:

Must be a U.S. Citizen
Must a past federal pre-employment background investigation.
Associates Degree or equivalent experience. Equivalent experience includes:
4+ years experience supporting program data analysis activities with no related degree; OR
2+ years experience supporting program data analysis activities with related Associates Degree; OR
No experience with a related BA or BS degree.
Specializes in data analysis in one or more of the following areas:
Tax; Finance; Accounting; Budgeting; Auditing; Quality control; Research; Legal and regulatory compliance; Administration.
Other similar management and operational activities.
Superior customer service, interpersonal, and communication skills.
Ability to take the initiative and use independent judgment.
Has held the Business Data Analyst position for at least 1 year
Ability to utilize multiple applications, Google Sheets and Microsoft office suite.
Highly organized and detail oriented.

Comparable Federal Grade Level: GS-06 Step 1

Eligible for Mobile Work: Yes

Introduction:
SymphonyAI MediaAI (SAIM) is the preeminent leader in Audit and Revenue Management Services for the Media industry; auditing billions of dollars each year in license fees, retransmission consent fees, subscriber fees, and royalty payments on behalf of major media companies in the Fortune 500 throughout the world.
Due to a consistent increase in the demand for our services, SymphonyAI Media is seeking a results-driven, highly motivated Senior Financial Analyst to join our Audit Services team.

Due to a consistent increase in the demand for our services, SymphonyAI Media is seeking a results-driven, highly motivated Senior Financial Analyst to join our Audit Services team.
Job Description:
Essential Functions

Independently analyze data to determine trends, variances, and inconsistencies.
Review and analyze cable billing reports containing large volumes of cable/satellite/IPTV/digital distribution subscriber and revenue data.
Review and analyze content distribution contracts for compliance, audit variances and areas of risk.
Complete complex audit report packages using our specialized internal software programs and analytical tools to ultimately present audit report packages to our clientele (content owners).
Complete in-depth financial analysis of multiple-revenue streams and subscriber systems.
Provide detailed and sustainable recommendations to our clients.
Work with a team of auditors throughout all phases of the audit process, including fieldwork, post-fieldwork, contract compliance and report processing.
Assists in the management and planning of audit engagements, with supervision from Senior Management.
Review audit fieldwork completed by Staff Auditors, completing Quality Control review, reviewing for variances, trends, inconsistencies, and audit findings.
Review audit report packages completed by Staff Auditors prior to delivery to SAIM audit clientele.

Core Competencies

CPA certification required for this role (please note you will not be considered unless it is stated on your resume)
Prior audit experience required.
Ability to prioritize key projects and audit reports to meet contractual deadlines and client demands, using input and priorities provided from various members of the Senior Management Team.
Superior Organization Skills.
Excellent communication skills – ability to communicate effectively within all levels of the organization.
Strong aptitude for data and numerical analytics.
Highly developed critical thinking aptitude, with a demonstrated ability to think creatively and practically when resolving issues.
Advanced business writing skills, with proven experience.
Capacity to quickly learn new processes and procedures in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to effectively manage personal workload, team workload and changing priorities.
Superior teamwork capabilities and a results-oriented nature.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite: advanced Excel, basic to intermediate Access.
Willingness to work overtime and travel when required.

Required Education and Experience

BA/BS degree in a business discipline, preferably with an accounting or finance emphasis.
Minimum 2-3 years of experience working in a Financial Analyst or Staff Auditor capacity.
Minimum 1-3 years of experience preferred working in a Manager capacity – managing all phases of a project and/or team from commencement to final client delivery.

This role is Hybrid, with 2 days on-site in our Denver, CO office.

If you are enthusiastic about embracing innovation, prioritizing customer needs, achieving targeted performance, and working as a unified team, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume detailing your experience in these areas and be prepared to discuss how you would contribute to our values-driven culture.


The base salary range for this position is between $90,000-$95,000


The ranges shared are for the expectations as laid out in the job description, however we frequently consider varying levels of experience for a role and understand that the person we hire may be less experienced or more senior than this job description as posted.

About Us:
SymphonyAI is building the leading enterprise AI SaaS company for digital transformation across the most critical and resilient growth industries, including retail, consumer packaged goods, financial crime prevention, manufacturing, media, and IT service management. Since its founding in 2017, SymphonyAI today serves 1500+ Enterprise customers globally and has grown to 2,500 talented leaders, data scientists, and other professionals across over 20 countries.

Job Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Local, In-Office, Hybrid schedule

Do you love technology and helping organizations utilize that technology to become greater than they thought possible? Are you interested in serving your community and doing your part to keep your community, nation, and planet safe? At Kaseware you will have the chance to do all of that and so much more as a Business Data Analyst. Kaseware is a company that is changing the world of law enforcement and corporate security forever and, if you are up for a challenge, we would like you to consider helping us make the world a safer place.

The Data Analyst will work directly with our clients to identify, build and maintain reports and visualization of their data. Applicants should have scripting skills in programming languages like SQL and Python, as you will be responsible for writing queries and other data transformation scripts as well as experience working directly with end users. This role is essential to our clients, as the data and analysis you provide will inform our client’s business strategy as we move into the future.

Job Type: Full-time, Exempt

Responsibilities and Duties:



Writing SQL scripts and queries to extract and visualize client data
Working directly with customers to understand their data and visualization needs
Developing complex advancement reports using SQL, PowerBi, Microsoft Office and other utilities or languages as necessary
Utilizing Metabase to create client-facing reports, visualizations and dashboards
Creating views and other methods to facilitate easier reporting for clients
Performing ad hoc and structured data analysis
Generating quality reports
Identifying data issues proactively and flagging them to respective stakeholders
Uses modeling techniques and tools in analyzing and specifying data structure in large and/or complex data sets
Implementing best practices in data management to ensure the integrity of the data, the quality of data processes and delivers analyzable or analyzed data to a variety of internal and external clients

Required Education:

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Education, Mathematics, Engineering, Statistics, Finance, Economics or a related field

Required Skills and Experience:



A minimum of 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst
Experience in data analysis, warehousing, and reporting (3-5 years preferred)
SQL skills and experience with other programming languages associated with data analytics
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Advanced technical skills
Excellent documentation skills

Preferred Skills and Experience:

Experience using Metabase or a similar business intelligence tool

Other Requirements:

Language: English

Benefits:

Competitive salary and bonus program in an entrepreneurial environment.
Excellent health, dental, and vision insurance (70% company paid).
Unlimited paid time off plan plus paid holidays.
401k with company matching.

About Kaseware:


Kaseware is a dynamic start-up company located in the Denver metro area. We build state-of-the-art software for law enforcement and corporate security customers. We serve those that serve our communities and make our world safer.


Due to the nature of our business, you must be able to pass a full CJIS compliant fingerprint based background check, which is required for individuals needing access to criminal justice information (CJI).

U.S. Citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.

Job Title: SAS Program Management Lead Analyst/Data Analyst - Hybrid
Job Description:
This is a hybrid role and will require the ability to work in person.

Role Summary:

Data Analyst for our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program. This position will provide the technical component of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program in development, implementation, production monitoring and maintenance of our internal PrePay edits. Individual will work with our matrix partners to evaluate edit ideas and use business requirements to develop the technical processes to obtain desired results. Strong technical coding experience will be needed to be successful in this role.

Responsibilities:

Act as technical analyst for Proactive Claim Intervention projects and daily tasks for all aspects of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Data Analyst for the development, installation, execution and maintenance of our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Develop and maintain editing on regular and ad-hoc basis, primarily using SAS, Microsoft SQL Server and internally developed ARM application.
Responsible for data mining activities and technology integration of Pre/PostPay Correction Program to support our Pre/PostPay Edit editing program.
Evaluates and appropriately utilizes various approaches to data mining to narrow in on trends and drivers that directly impact outcomes.
Makes well-thought-out decisions on complex or ambiguous IT architecture issues.
Participate in all phases of Pre/PostPay Edit program IT architecture process testing and implementation
Ensures that system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.
Works closely with matrix business partners to define data needs, opportunities for improvement and effectively communicates results of analysis and solutions.
Acts as a resource for mentorship, training and guidance for junior staff.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree or higher strongly preferred in business, technology, or related field or equivalent work experience required.
5+ years of SAS coding experience required with proficient skills Microsoft SQL Server.
5+ years of experience in health care/managed care with proficient skills in medical analysis and project management.
Solid Excel experience preferred.
Strong data investigation skills to mine healthcare data required.
Strong data analysis skills with the ability to analyze large amount of healthcare data required.
Strong project management skills and comfort in ability to create and achieve success in highly matrixed environment.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to research, problem solve, trouble shoot, influence and partner across the organization to a drive toward resolution for the client, provider and organization.
Strong presentation skills. Able to prepare, deliver, and ensure understanding of information regarding any customer-related or process improvement topic across audiences.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and drive to objectives.



If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of 70,800 - 118,000 USD / yearly, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Description of Job

Who are we?
The Innovation Strategy Delivery (ISD) Division employs standard software development life-cycle methodology and tools to facilitate the gathering of business requirements allowing business partners to successfully meet the initiatives set for the Department of Revenue (DOR) using the technology resources available.

What do we need?
Our office is seeking a self-starter with a skill set that allows for gathering software development requirements, managing stakeholder expectations, translating business processes and rules into development specifications, independent meeting facilitation, and working within tight timelines. The ideal candidate will also possess the ability to consistently establish, build and maintain relationships in a team driven environment and with our partnered stakeholders.

What would a typical day look like for someone in this role?
The Business Analyst in this role will attend Scrum Events and be responsible for tracking and managing their assigned business area's sprint commitment(s) throughout the development life cycle. Each analyst attends, schedules, and facilitates meetings with various contacts in an effort to refine the development requests of our business stakeholder. The analyst will also assist with User Acceptance Testing.

Significant duties and responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to:

performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and managing user acceptance testing; creating documentation and manuals for multiple solutions;
assisting with implementing and supporting business solutions across numerous workgroups to provide solutions that help achieve the business's goals;
reviewing and diagnosing system problems to identify solutions and/or make referrals;
planning, designing, and analyzing user requirements for development and support;
high level multitasking, within the chat and email sector;
facilitating meetings and documenting actions, risks, decisions, and meeting minutes;
and providing essential system requirement identification, documentation analysis.
This position will have rare but occasional in office meetings at our Lakewood office.

Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.

Description:

Company Description:

At Lunavi, we believe in illuminating the path forward and helping our customers navigate what’s next. We are innovators who are combining the power of human ingenuity and technology to deliver unrivaled customer experience. We’re a trusted partner for companies looking to digitally transform their business, modernize business applications, solve traditional IT challenges, and extract ROI from technology. Our high performing teams, deep expertise, and proven processes help to propel businesses forward.

Our Core Values:

Be Great. Aspire to know more, do more, and realize your fullest potential. Keep reaching above and beyond to excel and exceed every expectation.

Reimagine Everything. Continuously create value by pursuing what's next, what's possible. Deliver a new level of awesome through relentless curiosity.

Ignite Passion. Share the very best of who you are in everything you do. Create a positive and uplifting environment that inspires others.

Own It. Know that your contributions make a direct impact. Be the difference that leads to more successful experiences and outcomes.

Job Description:

Lunavi is growing! We are currently looking for a Business Analyst/Quality Analyst that can excel in a fast-paced, customer facing role to support our project delivery teams. You’ll have the opportunity to gain experience across a wide range of technologies and industries, all while delivering innovative custom solutions for our internal and external customers. If this sounds like you, and you’re in alignment with our company core values, we’d love to speak with you!

Be the central role in carrying a client’s vision forward as you collaborate with a Lunavi Delivery Manager and a team of technology professionals to deliver solutions
Gain real-world experience and business knowledge working with a variety of clients across multiple industries
Build long-term relationships with client product owners, and the experts inside of the Lunavi Network of Partners
Leverage and apply proven Agile Scrum principles and best practices to enable bringing client visions to market
Use modern technologies and techniques to create and execute test cases based on acceptance criteria to ensure the solutions will deliver value to our clients and their stakeholders
Represent the team’s efforts as you demonstrate delivered work to business stakeholders within each sprint
Grow your professional skills as you pursue a development path towards the Delivery Manager role
Requirements:
Minimum of 3-4 years of professional experience working in a Business Analyst role on an Agile software development team.
Have a strong passion to collaborate and partner with both business and technology project team members to work together towards a shared vision
Be a quick learner who can ask the right questions to build an understanding of what our clients need
Ready to take ownership of ensuring user stories are captured and test cases are successfully executed
Strong communication skills to share user story acceptance criteria and test case results with technology-focused team members
Be an example self-starter who can help drive projects forward
Always looking for ways to improve and help others to do the same
Data analytic project experience
Position may require occasional travel to client sites

Fort Collins, CO

Position qualifies for hybrid/in-office work

Description of Work Unit
Founded in 1870, Colorado State University is among the nation’s leading research universities and enrolls approximately 32,000 undergraduate, graduate, and professional students. Located an hour north of the Denver metro area, Fort Collins is a vibrant community of approximately 157,000 residents that offers the convenience of a small town with all the amenities of a large city. Fort Collins is situated on the Front Range of the Rocky Mountains with views of 14,000 foot peaks, and offers access to numerous cultural, recreational, and outdoor opportunities.

The Office of Budgets exists to provide research and analysis on internal affairs in support of executive decision making, to provide research and analysis on external factors affecting university planning and reporting and to formulate policy and provide analysis on university budgetary issues. The budgetary function exists to prepare, monitor, and distribute university budgets from legislative requests to the final operating budget of the University and to provide support to the various areas of the University as well as the CSU System regarding budget problems and restrictions on an ongoing basis. Colorado State University (CSU) is a tier one Carnegie Research Institution and a recognized leader in infectious disease research.


Position Summary
The University Budget Office Budget Analyst reports to the Director of the Office of Budgets. The primary role of this position is to establish and monitor budgets, perform analysis of sub funds, research and analyze issues regarding budget planning, development, and procedures. Respond to information requests as assigned. In addition, this position will facilitate the training and implementation associated with the University budget load and annual salary raise exercise. The position ensures compliance with University, State and Federal policies and procedures and regulations.

The successful candidate will be proactive in identifying and addressing problems, have strong analytical skills and must be able to effectively communicate with a variety of stakeholders across campus.

Position has an option for a hybrid work week (4 days in office and 1 day remote).


Required Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, emphasis in Accounting, Finance, Financial Management, or related field.
Three years of experience in budget development, tracking and analysis.
Experience and working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite and the use of data mining tools.
Demonstrated in the application materials and interview process of professional communication skills with the ability to speak to all levels of the organization.
Strong organizational and complex problem-solving skills, follow-through, and attention to detail.


Preferred Job Qualifications
Demonstrated experienced in coordinating multiple areas including departments, colleges, and central administration.
Masters or MBA with a concentration in finance, accounting, or other related advanced degree.
Analytical abilities, including the use of statistical techniques, financial modeling, and data management.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and data mining tools.
Ability to work effectively in a multi-layered team environment, as well as autonomously.
Demonstrated knowledge and ability to foster and work within culturally diverse communities.
Experience in an institution of higher education or government.


Diversity Statement
Reflecting departmental and institutional values, candidates are expected to have the ability to advance the Department’s commitment to diversity and inclusion.


Essential Duties

Job Duty Category
University Budget Development


Duty/Responsibility
Advise and assist campus business officers and others, as needed, with the annual budget development process.
Assist with the development and implementation of procedures to facilitate and streamline the budget submission process, including formulation, evaluation, and verification of budgets.
Facilitate the coordination of training related to the annual budget submission process,
Assisting college and departmental personnel with budget development.

Facilitate the annual faculty/administrative professional salary raise exercise.
Assist with developing and implementing procedures to facilitate and streamline the salary raise exercise process.
Facilitate the coordination of training related to the salary raise exercise process.
Analyze data and prepare spreadsheets. These spreadsheets are then used as a means for communication to others across campus.
Develop and implement data queries to retrieve information to assist with budget and university planning, projections, and decision-making, and to provide information requested by CSU Administrators, State and Federal agencies, other higher education institutions, research groups and others.
Assists with creation and implementation of new organizations and departments within the university system which includes coordinating efforts with Institutional Research, Student Systems, Human Resources and Business and Financial Services personnel to ensure compliance with university policies and preservation of historic information.

60


Job Duty Category
University Budget Operations


Duty/Responsibility
Conduct ongoing reviews of budgets and financial activity for compliance with university fiscal policies.
Facilitate tracking and updating quarterly centralized fringe benefit salary control numbers for state appropriated funds.
Facilitate developing the annual raise base control numbers.
Process and approve budget change requests and other financial documents as needed.
Assist with monthly reconciliations of accounts within the Central areas.
Coordinates and distributes Central commitments to/from other University units.

30

Other


Duty/Responsibility
Prepares Ad Hoc financial analyses and reports working in conjunction with Office of Budgets staff and director.
Performs Ad Hoc research on best practices, policies, processes of peer and other higher education institutions on various topics of interest.
Other Duties as assigned.

10

Hazen and Sawyer is seeking a candidate in one of our Denver, Colorado offices as part of our utility management service group to provide financial analysis for water and wastewater utilities.

The Financial Analyst position will require teamwork and coordination to produce financial models, prepare reports, identify patterns and trends from various information sources, and make recommendations. The Financial Analyst is a supporting team member. His/her work will provide exposure to a range of water industry related financial systems and consulting services.

Financial Data Analytics
Return on Investment Analysis
Utility Rates and Charges and Cost of Service Analysis

Job Title: Salesforce Data Analyst - Revenue Operations - United States
Job Description:
All roles at JumpCloud are Remote unless otherwise specified in the Job Description.



About JumpCloud
JumpCloud’s mission is to Make Work Happen®, providing simple, secure access to an organization’s technology resources from any device, or any location. The JumpCloud Open Directory Platform gives IT, security operations, and DevOps a single, cloud-based solution to control and manage employee identities and their devices, and apply conditional access controls based on Zero Trust principals. Since launching in 2012, our global user base has grown to more than 150,000 organizations, with more than 6,000 paying customers including Cars.com, GoFundMe, Grab, ClassPass and Peloton. JumpCloud has raised over $400M from world-class investors including Sapphire Ventures, General Atlantic, Sands Capital, Atlassian, and CrowdStrike. Our teams are growing fast, too, and we're looking for talent across engineering, sales, customer success, marketing, product management, and more. Join our team of dedicated, passionate, and creative people who are eager to change the IT industry forever.

The position plays a key role on the Revenue Operations team, in support of the Go To Market organization. You will be responsible for the strategy and execution of various sales reporting and analytics. The ideal candidate needs to have experience with a software company pulling information from Salesforce to do Financial and Sales planning metrics etc. Ideally be skilled at gathering, manipulating, and understanding data resources and combines these skills with curiosity and a passion for solving organizational problems.
Responsibilities:
Develop various data models to understand historical data to help drive strategic objectives
Query and mine data resources to answer ad-hoc business questions
Manipulate data in SalesForce.com, Tableau, and Excel to deliver a holistic view of various sales metrics
Starting with raw data and a business need or question, deliver high-impact analyses and presentations
Understand business objectives and user needs to translate into requirements for reporting and analytics
Create advanced reporting and dashboards primarily in SalesForce.com and Tableau
Deliver data sets in a digestible format to sales leadership
Work with various stakeholders to develop scalable reporting and analytics solutions
What You Should Have:
Extensive SalesForce.com experience, preferable admin certified
4+ years of experience in data analytics,, sales or revenue operations
Excellent understanding and ability to drive required optimization in Salesforce
Experience working for a Software Company
Bachelor's degree in finance, economics, or business administration preferred
Strong financial modeling and analysis skills; program and project management skills required.
Ability to pull information from Salesforce to do Financial and Sales planning metrics etc
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; Must be comfortable presenting data to leadership teams
Ability to prioritize and work in high volume environment
Ability to work well with cross functional teams (Sales, Finance, Accounting, Billing, and Operations) and influence as well as build relationships with these teams.
In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual compensation range for this role for a candidate based in the United States, depending on individual candidate level and experience, is $100,000 - $130,000 including base salary and any related bonuses or commissions.

JumpCloud provides a comprehensive benefits package, with several medical plans to choose from including a high deductible HSA plan with employer contribution, two dental plans, vision insurance, flexible spending account (FSA), employee assistance program (EAP), short- and long-term disability, life insurance and a 401k savings plan with match. We have an unlimited vacation policy.

#LI-JW1

Where you’ll be working/Location:
JumpCloud is committed to being Remote First, meaning that you are able to work remotely within the country noted in this Job Description. For US Roles: All roles posted in United States locations do require that you be located within one of the 50 U.S. States. Our Headquarters is in the Denver/Boulder, CO area but as a remote company, you are able to work remotely anywhere in the U.S. If you would like to spend time in our offices in the Denver/Boulder area, you are welcome to do that as well.

Why JumpCloud?
If you thrive working in a fast, SaaS-based environment and you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems, we look forward to hearing from you! JumpCloud is an incredible place to share and grow your expertise! You’ll work with amazing talent across each department who are passionate about our mission. We’re out of the box thinkers, so your unique ideas and approaches for conceiving a product and/or feature will be welcome. You’ll have a voice in the organization as you work with a seasoned executive team, a supportive board and in a proven market that our customers are excited about.

One of JumpCloud's three core values is to “Build Connections.” To us that means creating " human connection with each other regardless of our backgrounds, orientations, geographies, religions, languages, gender, race, etc. We care deeply about the people that we work with and want to see everyone succeed." - Rajat Bhargava, CEO. JumpCloud is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Please submit your résumé and brief explanation about yourself and why you would be a good fit for JumpCloud. Please note JumpCloud is not accepting third party resumes at this time.
