University Staff
Description


Envision yourself in a collaborative, inclusive, and innovative work environment that has a deep commitment to position our graduates for success in their professional and personal lives. Visualize applying your energy and skills for an organization that respects and cares about its employees enough to offer some of the best benefits of the industry while encouraging every team member to grow, collaborate, and provide input on how to consistently make the workplace a place people love to work. Imagine working at a college that welcomes everyone — students, faculty, staff, and community members — regardless of their backgrounds, beliefs, or traditions. If what was just described is what you look for in a workplace, welcome to the University of Colorado Colorado Springs (UCCS)!

The UCCS Controller’s Office provides and promotes rigorous standards of technical accounting, auditing, and financial reporting to meet the business and management needs of campus customers and external constituents. The UCCS Controller works closely with the CU System Controller and represents the UCCS campus on accounting matters. The UCCS Controller’s Office is a service-oriented organization which processes transactions, generates, and monitors reports, provides financial information and decision support, and offers training and documentation for the execution of policies and procedures. It works with and has a higher level of understanding of the PeopleSoft financial and human resource software system, COGNOS reporting system, CONCUR travel & expense reporting system, SciQuest Solutions (CU Marketplace) as well as the State of Colorado’s Operations Resource Engine (CORE), this list is not all inclusive. The Financial Analyst performs professional accounting and information analysis activities. This position is responsible for proper accounting in accordance with all federal, state and University rules and regulations; compilation and analysis of data to provide insight and information for business support decisions; preparing cost study reports; implementing and maintaining internal controls; and providing consulting and training to campus stakeholders.

Who We Are:

The University of Colorado Colorado Springs (UCCS) is one of four campuses in the University of Colorado system and is home to over 9,000 undergraduate and 1,800 graduate students. We have a strong focus in fueling student success by creating, using, and maintaining a multitude of different offices and programs. Overall, UCCS is constantly focused of preparing our students to have success in the future, and we understand that every single employee on our campus has a significant effect on that focus. Find more information about working at UCCS here:

The city, which was recently ranked as the number nine Best Places to Live by U.S. News & World Report in 2022, known as Olympic City USA, rests at the base of Pikes Peak, the inspiration for the song “America the Beautiful” and a must-see for residents and visitors alike. With a mild climate and 247 days of sunshine each year, the Springs boasts some of the state’s best recreation opportunities. Find out more about living in Colorado Springs through the Visit Colorado Springs page:

Job Duties:

Record, classify, reconcile and correct various financial transactions.
Create and validate accuracy of year-end financial statements, related footnotes and workpapers for audit.
Interpret and maintain compliance with federal and state legislation, rules, regulations, institutional policies and procedures. Examples include GAAP, GASB, Higher Education Accounting Standards, Uniform Grant Guidelines, State Fiscal Rules, University of Colorado Policies and Procedures, etc.
Administer, review and monitor cost accounting principles and applications of the campus, including the:
Federally Negotiated Facilities and Administrative Rate (F&A) Proposal.
Fringe Benefit Rate Proposal.
Rate Based Service Activities of the campus, including both Internal Service Centers and External Rate Based Services.
Perform complex financial analysis & oversight of high-risk fiscal transactions:
Analyze data to ensure consistent application of financial policies and procedures.
Interpret financial records, perform comparative and fiscal analysis.
Develop and initiate recommendations for procedures to address University priorities and enhance operations.
Monitor a variety of reconciliations, as assigned.
Review and audit quality and accuracy of work for peers and other departments performing fiscal transactions.
Review exception reports such as abnormal balances, unchanged balances, suspense account balances, cash deficits, budget deficits, and more.
Support systems infrastructure, reports, and processes
Create and maintain a data framework that ensures accuracy, compliance, effective operations and reporting.
Collect, analyze, and disseminate financial information; prepare reports and summaries.
Write ad-hoc queries for multiple data sources for financial reporting, analysis and/or review.
Identify potential issues and initiate corrective action to ensure accurate and appropriate reporting.
Assist with training and implementation of system upgrades.
Work with system and campus representatives to troubleshoot issues and maintain business processes for PeopleSoft Finance.
Report within the State financial system, CORE, complete journal entries as needed, review, reconcile and correct variances.
Provide accounting expertise, training and guidance to campus departmental finance and accounting staff.
Maintain appropriate records and documents for financial statement and compliance audits, generate documentation related to audit requests.
Participate in internal and external committees, work with multi-campus teams on system-wide projects.
Other duties as assigned.

The job duties listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification and are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Specific duties and responsibilities may vary depending on department or program needs without changing the general nature and scope of the job or level of responsibility. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.

Job Competencies:

Knowledge and application of GAAP, GASB, and higher education accounting principles, concepts, and practices.
Ability to plan, organize and meet deadlines, work under pressure and organize multiple projects or tasks.
Ability to extract, research, investigate, and reconcile data.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to analyze financial data, determine its meaning and how the information relates to the overall operations.
Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial reports, and legal documents.
Ability to communicate effectively both in writing and orally to staff and senior administration.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Strong interpersonal and human relations skills.
Experience with highly automated financial management systems and the processes required to make these systems function.

Work Location: On-site

This position has been determined to be exempt from the overtime provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA).

What We Offer:

Salary Range: Generally starting at $53,461 - $68,982 per year

The salary of the finalist(s) selected for this role will be set based on a variety of factors, including but not limited to, internal equity, experience, education, specialty and training.

The University of Colorado Colorado Springs offers excellent benefits, some of which include:

Medical insurance, with the lowest cost option being $0 to the employee
Dental, Vision, Life and Disability insurance
Generous paid vacation and sick time accruals (14.67 hours of vacation and 10 hours of sick accrued per month, prorated if part-time)
Mandatory retirement plans. Employees contribute 5% of their annual compensation. CU doubles that and contributes 10%
Tuition Assistant Benefit available to you or a dependent
Paid Parental Leave after 12 months of employment
Off Campus Housing Resources

This position is eligible for paid sick leave. Information on benefits, including eligibility, is located at:

Symphony MediaAI’s (SMAI) vision is to create a System of intelligence through a suite of solutions that assists clients through AI and Machine Learning. Already the preeminent leader in Audit and Revenue Management Services for the media industry; auditing billions of dollars on behalf of major media companies in the Fortune 500 throughout the world, we are evolving with the media industry to provide it with the next generation of intelligence and insight that will propel our clients’ business forward through an ever-changing landscape.


Due to a consistent increase in the demand for our services, Symphony MediaAI is seeking a results-driven, highly motivated Media Financial Analyst to join our Audit team.


As the Media Financial Analyst you will be responsible for: a unique combination of skills; with detail-orientation and solid accounting skills of traditional auditing coupled with the critical thinking and creativity of financial analysis.


Essential Job Responsibilities:




Review and analyze billing reports containing large volumes of subscriber and revenue data applicable to cable/satellite/IPTV/digital distribution systems.
Independently analyze data to determine trends, variances and inconsistencies.
Review and analyze client contracts for compliance, audit variances and areas of risk.
Complete complex audit report packages using our specialized internal software programs and analytical tools to ultimately present audit report packages to our clientele.
Work with a team of auditors throughout all phases of the audit process, including fieldwork, post-fieldwork, contract compliance and report processing.
Complete in-depth financial analysis of multiple-revenue streams and subscriber systems.
Provide detailed and sustainable recommendations to our clients.



Essential Skills, Experience, Abilities & Education:




BA/BS degree in Accounting, Finance or related field.
Strong aptitude for financial and numerical analysis.
Excellent verbal and business writing skills.
Ability to process large volumes of data.
Previous financial analysis and/or audit experience desired.
Knowledge of database structure and query language useful.



The salary range for this position is between $50,000 - $65,000

About Gusto

Gusto is a modern, online people platform that helps small businesses take care of their teams. On top of full-service payroll, Gusto offers health insurance, 401(k)s, expert HR, and team management tools. Today, Gusto offices in Denver, San Francisco, and New York serve more than 300,000 businesses nationwide.

Our mission is to create a world where work empowers a better life, and it starts right here at Gusto. That's why we're committed to building a collaborative and inclusive workplace, both physically and virtually. Learn more about our Total Rewards philosophy.

We're looking for talented and motivated Senior Salesforce Business Analyst with 5+ years of experience. This candidate should be comfortable always asking "why" and challenging the status quo here at Gusto. The ideal candidate for this role is highly organized, an expert at translating functional requirements into technical solutions, and passionate about problem solving and building for the future.

The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will be joining our BizTech BSA team and will partner closely with Gusto's functional leadership teams to continue to scale Gusto's Salesforce instance. This individual will be responsible for ensuring our business partner's requirements are translated into technical requirements. The ideal candidate will analyze data to help Gusto determine how best we can continue to scale our Salesforce instance in the future to improve our customer experience with our Gusto Team.

Here's what you'll do day-to-day:

Drive system improvements by ensuring effective requirements elicitation, configuration, administration, development, and application support for our Salesforce platform
Manage projects and partner closely with members of the cross-functional teams to roll out new systems or reduce inefficiencies in our current processes
Manage integrated applications and third party suppliers including NICE CXOne, Qualtrics, Chili Piper, Outreach, RingLead, Catalyst and more.
Be a technology strategist, partnering with stakeholders and taking ownership of the roadmap and products they use to reduce inefficiencies and support Gusto as we scale.
Build and maintain effective Gustie experiences using Salesforce Service and Sales Clouds.
Be accountable for the vision, strategy, and roadmap for our lead-to-cash capabilities.
Own the communication of any platform changes to end users and stakeholders
Conduct proactive system maintenance including Security Reviews, Release Updates, Health Check, and Optimizer

Here's what we're looking for:

5+ years of experience as a business analyst supporting Revenue organizations. Bonus points for Revenue-generating experience.
4+ years of experience with strategic ownership of a Salesforce platform including vision, roadmap, and work prioritization
Comprehensive Salesforce product knowledge and hands-on administration experience with Sales cloud.
Experience designing and supporting large scale, technically complex solutions on Salesforce
Certified Salesforce Administrator
A desire to implement best practice solutions
Strong communication skills and experience collaborating across many different operating teams

Learn more about the team:

Our Engineering Culture and Values

Due to a consistent increase in the demand for our services, SymphonyAI Media is seeking a results-driven, highly motivated Senior Media Financial Analyst to join our Audit team. As the Senior Media Financial Analyst you will be responsible for:

Provide detailed and sustainable recommendations to our clients.

Assists in the management and planning of audit engagements, with supervision from Senior Management.
Review audit fieldwork completed by Staff Auditors, completing Quality Control review, reviewing for variances, trends, inconsistencies, and audit findings.
Review audit report packages completed by Staff Auditors prior to delivery to SAIM audit clientele.



To be considered for this role, it is highly preferred that you possess:




Prior audit experience required.
CPA, or other similar professional designation, a plus.
Ability to prioritize key projects and audit reports to meet contractual deadlines and client demands, using input and priorities provided from various members of the Senior Management Team.
Superior Organization Skills.
Excellent communication skills – ability to communicate effectively within all levels of the organization.
Strong aptitude for data and numerical analytics.
Highly developed critical thinking aptitude, with a demonstrated ability to think creatively and practically when resolving issues.
Advanced business writing skills, with proven experience.
Capacity to quickly learn new processes and procedures in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to effectively manage personal workload, team workload and changing priorities.
Superior teamwork capabilities and a results-oriented nature.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite: advanced Excel, basic to intermediate Access.
Willingness to work overtime and travel when required.



Required Education and Experience




BA/BS degree in a business discipline, preferably with an accounting or finance emphasis.
Minimum 2-3 years of experience working in a Financial Analyst or Staff Auditor capacity.
Minimum 1-3 years of experience preferred working in a Manager capacity – managing all phases of a project and/or team from commencement to final client delivery.



The salary range for this position is between $ 65,000 - $ 85,000

Description of Job

This is a joint posting for three open positions. Two (2) Rule writer positions in the Regulator Development Unit and one (1) Regulatory Specialist/Data Analyst position in the Air Toxics Unit will be hired from a shared pool of applications. Please ensure that you note which unit you would prefer in the supplemental questions.

The Work Unit:
The Regulatory Development Unit develops and implements regulations for stationary sources that emit air pollutants and odorous gasses into the atmosphere; assists stationary sources with complying with regulations, policies and programs as set forth by the Clean Air Act and promulgated by the U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, the Air Quality Control Commission and the Department; and develops partnerships with other agencies and the regulated community to advance environmental and public health goals through the development of innovative policies, programs and environmental projects.

The Air Toxics Regulatory and Program Development Unit within the Planning and Policy Program develops and aids in the implementation of regulations and other program elements related to the legislative directives set forth in House Bill 22-1244 (Public Protections from Toxic Air Contaminants) (HB 22-1244). This includes developing regulatory requirements related to: air toxics reporting; identification of priority toxic air contaminants; health-based standards for priority air toxics; and emission control regulations for priority toxic air contaminants. The work unit also coordinates with other programs within the division as well as with other work units within the department related to the development and implementation of a robust air quality program aimed at reducing the impacts of toxic air contaminants in Colorado.

Both of these units coordinate and work with other units within the Planning and Policy program in developing regulations, plans and other program elements related to air pollution more broadly. All of these activities include working closely with external stakeholders such as the general public, disproportionately impacted communities, non-governmental organizations, the regulated community, the U. S. Environmental Protection Agency, and the Air Quality Control Commission and the Department; and develops partnerships with other agencies and the regulated community to advance environmental and public health goals through the development of innovative policies, programs and environmental projects.

What you will be doing
AIR TOXICS REGULATIONS REGULATORY SPECIALIST/DATA ANALYST:
The purpose of this position is to learn to conduct regulation development activities and provide outreach related to the implementation of regulations and other program elements as directed in HB 22-1244. The position assists in coordinating with other programs within the division, units within the department, and external stakeholders, in developing the various elements of Colorado’s air toxics program under the direction of a supervisor or work leader.

RULE WRITER:
The purpose of this position is to learn to conduct regulation development activities and provide outreach related to the implementation of regulations and other program elements as directed in federal programs such as New Source Performance Standards (NSPS) and National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAP), and National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS). Additionally, this position will conduct regulation development for state-only policies, including air toxics regulations required by HB 22-1244 as well as other regulations governing emission reporting and control strategies for criteria air pollutants.

Job Duties:
AIR TOXICS REGULATIONS REGULATORY SPECIALIST/DATA ANALYST:
Air Toxic Reporting Program Evaluation and Analysis
Under direct supervision, this position evaluates existing state and federal air toxic contaminants reporting requirements and analyzes reported air toxic data and creates tools and guidance to facilitate accurately reported emissions. This position interacts with stakeholders including entities that may be subject to reporting requirements.

Regulatory Development Activities related to HB 22-1244 including air toxic reporting rules, listing of priority toxic air contaminants, health-based standards, and emission control regulations
Under direct supervision, this position develops proposed regulatory requirements that will be presented to the AQCC for adoption. The documentation for each regulatory action shall meet the requirements of the AQCC. These regulatory requirements will address multiple rulemaking components under HB 22-1244, including establishing reporting requirements, modifying reporting requirements to address any gaps in reporting requirements, listing priority air toxics, and developing emission control regulations for priority air toxics.

Evaluate and Analyze Emission Control Strategies for Air Toxics
Under direct supervision, this position researches, evaluates, and analyzes emission control strategies for priority air toxic contaminants. This position interacts with stakeholders including entities that may own or operate facilities subject to control requirements or communities where these facilities are located.

Technical Assistance
Under direct supervision, this position provides technical assistance (e.g., guidance documents, trainings) for Division staff and industries regulated under federal and state air quality regulations; educates trade and professional organizations about air quality requirements; and provides technical information specific to the site, situation, or industry about the use of pollution control equipment and alternative methods of reducing and/or eliminating emissions.

Coordinate with other Programs and Work Units on Air Toxics Activities (Project Coordination)
Under direct supervision, this position coordinates with other programs within the Division and other work units within the department regarding the development and implementation of the air toxics program created under HB 22-1244. The bill creates a broad reaching air toxics program that touches other programs and work units, including air toxics monitoring conducted by the Technical Services Program, development of air toxics health based standard under the direction of the Toxicology and Environmental Epidemiology Office, and oversight of emissions reporting by the Compliance and Enforcement Program. These activities, along with regulatory and program development activities, overlap requiring coordination among the various programs and work units.

Maintain technical expertise and support special projects
Attends staff meetings and participates in meetings, seminars, classes, teleconferences, task forces, special projects, webinars, and self-study courses, including NACAA conference calls and WESTAR conferences to maintain an current working knowledge of air pollution regulations, issues and practices, especially those which affect industry; and keeps current with upcoming regulations, advancing pollution prevention and reduction technologies, and effective methods of conducting compliance outreach.

RULE WRITER:
Regulatory Research and Development
Under direct supervision this position:

Tracks federal New Source Performance Standards (NSPS), Emission Guidelines (EG), National Emission Standards for Hazardous Air Pollutants (NESHAPs), New Source Review (NSR)/Prevention of Significant Deterioration (PSD), Title V Permitting regulations, and GHG reduction efforts.
Analyzes and interprets state and federal Clean Air Act regulations; studies scientific data and reports relating to air emissions.
Develops policies, procedures, interpretations, options, recommendations, and regulations for new and amended NSPS, NESHAPs, NSR/PSD, Title V Permitting, State Implementation Plans, GHG reductions, Air Toxics regulations required under HB22-1244, and other state and federal regulations for presentation and adoption by the Air Quality Control Commission (AQCC).
Conducts research and prepares necessary analysis and documentation to satisfy AQCC procedural rules, Colorado’s Administrative Procedures Act, and related Executive Orders.
Makes presentations, hosts workshops, leads and organizes technical workgroups, and attends meetings at off-site locations as needed.
Presents draft and final rule language, statements of basis and purpose, and supporting technical analyses (e.g., economic impact analysis, cost/benefit analysis, regulatory analysis) at request for rulemaking hearings and rulemaking hearing before the AQCC; and advocates for the Division’s proposed rule revisions before the AQCC.
Attends and prepares presentations for the various meetings that are part of the AQCC rulemaking process for rulemaking parties.

Data analysis
Under direct supervision this position:
Researches, evaluates, and analyzes annual reported air emission data and emission control strategies for a variety of pollutants, including priority air toxic contaminants and/or other criteria pollutant emission reduction strategies.

Technical Assistance
Under direct supervision this position:
Provides technical assistance (e.g., guidance documents, and trainings) for Division staff and industries regulated under federal and state air quality regulations.
Educates trade and professional organizations about air quality requirements.
Provides technical information specific to the site, situation, or industry about the use of pollution control equipment and alternative methods of reducing and/or eliminating emissions.
Analyzes data to determine types of pollutants emitted and calculates emission levels to determine compliance with federal and state air quality regulations.

Maintain Technical Expertise
Under direct supervision this position:
Attends staff and other meetings, seminars, classes, teleconferences, webinars, and self-study courses, including NACAA conference calls and WESTAR conferences, to maintain a current working knowledge of air pollution regulations, issues, and practices, especially those which affect industry and keeps current with upcoming regulations, changing policies, advancing pollution prevention and reduction technologies, and effective methods of conducting compliance outreach.
Attends meetings, serves on task forces or teams, completes projects, and performs other duties as assigned by the supervisor.

Other Duties as Assigned
Attends meetings, serves on task forces or teams, completes projects, and performs other duties as assigned by the supervisor."



Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights

Residency Requirement:
This posting is only open to residents of the State of Colorado at the time of submitting your application.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution in science, engineering, or environmental policy or economics or a closely related field in a field of study related to the work assignment.

AND

One (1) year of experience in air emission control technology assessments, air quality policy or regulatory development, or air quality emission reporting or data analysis) in an occupational field related to the work assigned to the position.

Substitutions:

Additional appropriate experience will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis.

Additional appropriate education will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
In addition to the minimum requirements, the successful candidate in this position will have the following experience:

Minimum GPA of 3.0 (unofficial copy of college transcripts required to verify)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong attention to detail and time management skills
The ability to work well in multidisciplinary teams to meet deadlines established by Colorado statute or by supervisor
Strong data analysis skills (spreadsheets or databases)
Knowledge of air pollution policy, regulations, emission estimation techniques, or control technologies.

Appeal Rights: (Updated)

An applicant who has been removed from an employment list or removed from consideration during the selection process may request a review by the State Personnel Director.

As an applicant directly affected by the results of the selection or comparative analysis process, you may file a written appeal with the State Personnel Director.

Review of the completed, signed and submitted appeal will be timely on the basis of written material submitted by you, using the official appeal form signed by you or your representative. This form must be completed and delivered to the State Personnel Board by email at dpa_state.personnelboard@state.co.us within ten (10) calendar days from your receipt of notice or acknowledgement of the Department’s action.

For further information on the Board Rules, you can refer to 4 Colorado Code of Regulations (CCR) 801-1, State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, Chapter 8, Resolution of Appeals and Disputes, at spb.colorado.gov/board-rules.

Supplemental Information

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

A pre-employment background check will be conducted as part of the selection process.
Travel 10%of the time, may be alone or with colleagues, to attend Meetings or trainings.

A complete application packet must include:
A completed State of Colorado application.
Cover letter - describing how your professional/supervisory experience aligns with the preferred qualifications of this position and what interests you in this position
Writing sample that you created for an academic or professional setting. If the sample is part of a larger group project report please highlight or document the sections of the report that you were the primary author on to assist reviewers with evaluating your written communication skills.
Answered supplemental questions.

The Selection Process:
All applications that are received by the closing of this announcement will be reviewed against the Minimum Qualifications in this announcement. Candidates who meet the minimum qualifications proceed to the next step.
Colorado Revised Statutes require that state employees are hired and promoted based on merit and fitness through a comparative analysis process.
Part of, or all of, the comparative analysis for this position may be a structured application review, which involves a review of the information you submit in your application materials by Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) against the preferred qualifications.
A top group, up to six candidates, will be invited to schedule an interview with the hiring manager.
E-Verify: CDPHE uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States. Learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities.

You must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be appointed to this position. CDPHE does not sponsor non-residents of the United States.

OPIR Data Quality Analyst
Aurora, CO

ICR has opportunities available for experience and motivated Overhead Persistent InfraRed (OPIR) Data Quality Analysts. This position monitors performance of processing operation by performing day-to-day, near real-time checks to determine how well processing tools, techniques and procedures are performing.
This position is contingent upon contract award, subsequent funding, and clearance cross-over.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Active Top Secret Security Clearance with SSBI.
A Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or a related field and 4+ years of experience.
Exceptional analytical skills and problem-solving skills.
Willingness to learn new skills and technologies.
Good organization, decision making, and verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to perform tasks on a team with supervision and guidance.
Required Job Functions
Obtain and administer the mission data necessary for daily performance monitoring.
Identify options for optimizing performance of processing systems.
Log discrepancies to the processors ability to collect and characterize signals of interest.
Recommend modifications to processing operating policies.
Review or create trouble reports for processing system anomalies.
Develop tasking criteria for the emitter mapping architecture.
Coordinate tasking and execution of emitter mapping capabilities with partner overhead tasking organizations.
Monitor performance of processing systems during calibration activities, as required.
Develop and maintain ground processing system metrics to support optimization for detection, processing, geolocation, and dissemination timeliness, throughput, and quality.
Maintain trending statistics to support evaluation of tasking and system output.
Provide timely and accurate responses to customer requests for metrics.
Develop scripts to support the extraction of metrics.
Shift work may be required to support 24/7 operations.


The position offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes company equity, retirement plan, company-paid health care benefits, a flexible paid time off policy, and opportunity for a raise and bonus during the year.

ICR, Inc. considers several factors when extending job offers, including but not limited to candidates’ skills, relevant work experience, education, training and certifications.

Description





BUSINESS ANALYST - VISIT GRAND JUNCTION
Hiring Range: $6,157 - $6,930 per Month

New to the City? Receive 40 Hours PTO Upon Hire!
Up to $2,500 in Relocation Reimbursement

A bout the Position:
Visit Grand Junction is seeking a Business Analyst to perform a variety of data, financial, and business analysis duties, including managing the organization’s annual budget, researching, interpreting, and analyzing local & industry data using Visit Grand Junction’s data platform, and identifying meaningful insights, to determine overall fiscal, operational, and service impacts. Candidate must possess solid business, financial and data acumen combined with strong analytical skills and a strategic view of marketing and performance metrics to uncover insights and drive advanced decision-making. The Analyst will assist in overseeing a fast-paced office, manage and collaborate with the marketing staff on multiple projects with overlapping deadlines, and manage assigned staff. If you are a dedicated business, finance, or data professional with a passion for research and excel in a fast-paced work environment, we encourage you to apply!

What We Offer:
The City of Grand Junction offers an excellent benefits package that supports quality work-life balance, including health and dental insurance, retirement, paid leave, a City employee health clinic, and a wellness program. The City offers a 10-step pay plan. The hiring range for a Business Analyst is $6,156,.68 - $ $6,929.73 monthly, which represents steps 1 to 5 of the pay plan. Each year, with the approval of the Grand Junction City Council, employees receive an additional step/pay increase of 2.5%.

About Visit Grand Junction:
Visit Grand Junction (Visit GJ), the Destination Marketing Organization is a Department of the City of Grand Junction. Visit GJ is responsible for enhancing Grand Junction’s brand to create an attractive destination while enhancing its public image as a dynamic place to live and work. Through the promotion of travel and tourism, Visit GJ strengthens Grand Junction’s economic position, which provides a sustainable, diverse, and consistent economy that supports businesses, and enhances the quality of life for residents. The team consists of dynamic individuals who are culture-focused, innovative, driven, intellectually curious, and dedicated to supporting the travel and tourism industry while reaching departmental goals that serve the Grand Junction area community and guests. The Department is a cutting-edge marketing organization built upon a foundation of data science.

About Our Culture:
The City of Grand Junction focuses on continuous improvement, collaborative partnerships, and exemplary service. The Core Values are demonstrated by a willingness to challenge the status quo, the ability to work together using all areas of expertise to achieve a common goal, and a commitment to fulfilling the needs of the community through thoughtful interactions. The City of Grand Junction welcomes employees who share these values.

About the Area:
Grand Junction, Colorado, is the key access point to the mountains and canyonlands of western Colorado and eastern Utah. Centrally located between Denver, CO (250 miles east) and Salt Lake City, UT (270 miles west), Grand Junction was named for the convergence of the Gunnison River and Colorado River. Over 1.5 million acres of public lands connect the area’s alpine terrain with the dramatic high desert, nourished by powerful rivers which sustain the vibrant agriculture industry. Opportunities for outdoor adventures are abundant in every season due to the year-round temperate climate. Home to “Nature’s Trifecta,” Grand Junction is surrounded by the Colorado National Monument – a mini-Grand Canyon, Rattlesnake Arches – the second-largest concentration of natural arches outside of Arches National Park, and the Grand Mesa – the largest flat-top mountain in the world. Agritourism, art and history, boutique shopping, and trendy restaurants compliment the outdoor recreation scene. With a population of over 155,000 in Mesa County (68,000 within the City limits), Grand Junction has many big town amenities without the big town stresses. With 300+ days of sunshine and easy accessibility, Grand Junction is the perfect place to live, work, and play. See V isit Grand Junction for videos and information.



Duties

What You'll Do:



Project, formulate, and manage the Visit Grand Junction annual budget and regularly perform detailed financial and business operation analysis data, including long-range forecasting of revenue generation, developing strategies to maximize revenue and reduce expenditures, and return on investment. Research, identify, keep abreast of, and report meaningful insights, trends, issues, concerns, and opportunities to mitigate risk and improve business operations and processes. Provide highly responsible and complex financial support to management and staff.
Regularly monitor, conduct, and critically analyze industry & marketing research while evaluating the state of the local and national economy, to determine travel and tourism trends and insights. Analyze, model, and interpret data patterns and trends, and create visualizations using Visit Grand Junction’s Tableau platform to ensure accurate analysis and projections. Conduct competitive research and analyze benchmarking data. Ensure marketing initiatives and financial objectives such as growth, margins, and productivity are appropriately analyzed and aligned with the budget. Write business narratives and create presentations.
Manage the work and activities of assigned staff, including onboarding; participate in the selection of staff; and work with employees to correct deficiencies and implement discipline procedures as needed.
Manage and oversee department operations and work closely with the Visit Grand Junction Director to resolve challenges and provide recommendations for quality and process improvement. Manage multiple complex and intricate marketing projects and strategic initiatives with overlapping deadlines.
Work with community stakeholders and boards, City and Department committees, City staff, and contracted vendors to problem-solve and implement solutions. Assist with projects, reports, communications, and presentations, including preparation for board meetings, staff meetings, community programs, agency proposals, contract management, stakeholder services, and annual reports.
To view the full job description, please

Qualifications

What We're Looking For:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Finance, Accounting, Business Management, or a related field, or commensurate professional experience. Proven analytical ability and high level of mathematical intelligence.
Ability to analyze, model, and interpret data and produce clear graphical visualizations using Excel, Tableau, and Power BI; must be able to write and edit analytical reports proficiently with keen attention to detail.
Ability to transform complex facts and figures into visualizations and commentary that can be easily understood. Strong written and verbal communication skills, including technical copy-editing skills.
Ability to manage and direct the work of assigned staff. Proven management and supervisory experience is desired. Understanding or ability to learn programming languages and platforms, including Tableau and Power BI; advanced proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications.
Understanding of marketing and willingness to learn industry insights.
Project management experience; capable of independent judgment and strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
Willingness to acknowledge and implement chain of command principles and protocols when encountering opportunities and challenges that affect the department and/or other departments.
Ability to manage competing priorities and apply effective organization and time management skills to meet overlapping deadlines.
Capable of working well independently and collaborating in a team environment.
Demonstrates intellectual curiosity and acquires skills related to the position, especially due to the fast-paced and always-changing marketing industry.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, progressive, always evolving work product and collaborative team environment.
Must foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, trust, vulnerability, and accountability.
Must be ambitious, conscientious, and curious.
Must be comfortable with a data-oriented organization and enjoy being challenged.



Supplemental Information

We believe in respect for all and do not discriminate based on hair, race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, gender expression and sexual orientation), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law is not allowed.

Mission

Headquartered in the Denver Tech Center, Colas IS Support is the information technology arm of Colas North America. Our vision is to deliver world class services, strategy and processes that support our construction and manufacturing operations. We work to provide timely access to information and knowledge in an integrated, open and collaborative environment, and aim to be the standard bearer for excellence in quality, customer service and reliability. We are building a company culture where both individual and team effort are rewarded and value employees that look forward to the challenge of exceeding customer expectations.


As a JDE Payroll Support and Business Analyst, you’ll be part of a team of diversely skilled individuals who pride themselves in their breadth of knowledge, troubleshooting skills and positive attitudes. You will help to support and enhance JDE HCM/Payroll software solutions that touch every part of the business. You’ll assist customers with incidents, interacting with them directly on a daily basis, as well as working on change requests, development projects and system maintenance.

Main Responsibilities
Assist our Canadian customers in maximizing their use of our information systems
Work with your manager and team to enhance existing JDE HCM/Payroll solutions.
Gather business requirements and translate processes into clear user documentation.
Work with teams and customers to identify software bugs, research and recommend resolutions.
Assist with analysis, planning, testing and deployment of software patches and upgrades.
Skills/Qualifications
5 years JDE Payroll/HCM experience
Knowledge of and experience with US and Canadian payroll reporting and year end requirements including T4, Releve 1, ROE, W2, ACA, benefit and pension rules
College degree in accounting, HCM, business or equivalent.
Empathize and communicate with customers to ensure satisfaction
Multitask effectively to ensure no customer is forgotten and no project undone
Analyze trends to improve both the support process and user training
Experience with Microsoft Office Professional Suite and application support.
Ability to communicate and train business users on software solutions.
Strong analytical and troubleshooting ability with particular attention to quality, detail, and follow-through.
Customer Service Experience
Strong written and verbal communication
Ability to work autonomously
Highly Favorable Qualifications
JDE HCM/Payroll certifications
PCP (Payroll Compliance Practitioner) or CPM (Certified Payroll Manager)
The ability to read, write and speak French.
Additional Information
Ability to travel to US and Canadian locations and participate in JDE implementations – 50% or more during implementations
Acts responsibly and holds themselves accountable for their performance
Takes the initiative to fill whatever need they see
Treats everyone with respect and is a model of integrity
Is a quick learner and problem solver
Salary Range: $134,000 - $140,000. Salary dependent on experience.

The main function of a business analyst is to maintain vendor relationships, acting as a business analyst for non-IT projects or filling organizational roles above an administrative level, but below a management level. Other responsibilities may include maintaining all project management processes, including project goals, deadlines, metrics and budget. The business analyst usually reports to a project manager or director.
Job Responsibilities:
Establish and maintain communication services across business units or from the project team to the organization.
Maintain the storage and retrieval of all project communications data and business metrics. Review contracts, cost proposals and contract supplements.
Set up project and work breakdown structures.
Establish and document business processes.
Track project budgets and expenditures, monitor transaction controls and costs against budgets.
Predict potential budget overruns and offer solutions.
Skills:
Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, customer service and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and manage ones time.
Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, and production methods.
Ability to apply accounting and mathematical principles to work as needed.
Ability to analyze business trends and project future revenues and expenses.
Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word and Excel; Enterprise Application experience a plus.
Education/Experience: Bachelor's degree in business management, economics, finance, accounting or relevant field required. 5-7 years experience required.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Job Title: Financial Analyst I, II or III
Company Name: Tri-State Generation and Transmission Association Inc.
Job Description:
Responsible for establishing and analyzing daily cash positions, executing funds movement, performing short-term investing, maintaining fraud prevention services, cash forecasting, and cash reports related to cash management. Primarily responsible for maintaining daily cash transactions in treasury workstation and bank specific systems, which includes determining the daily cash requirements, including the amount of investment or borrowing required to maintain a minimal positive daily cash position for all bank accounts - in all cases meeting daily intraday cutoff times. Reconciles current and prior day banking activity and resolve any variances immediately including reporting of any fraud to appropriate contacts as soon as possible. Partner with other Financial Analyst or Department Lead to ensure overall compliance with various Internal Controls for Financial Reporting.

Note: There is one position available, and this position will be filled at one of three job grade levels: Financial Analyst I (Cash Management), job grade 5, Financial Analyst II (Cash Management), job grade 7 or Financial Analyst III (Cash Management), job grade 8. This decision will be based on the qualifications and experience of the selected candidate and Tri-State business needs at the time of hire.

Tri-State recognizes the value of a highly engaged and committed workforce and provides an excellent benefits program that includes: Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Flexible Work Schedules including compressed work week and telecommuting opportunities to work remotely up to 50%, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA), Tuition Reimbursement, Life Insurance, Retirement Option, Long Term Disability (LTD), Short Term Disability (STD), Employee Assistant Program (EAP) and Paid Leave Benefits.

Financial Analyst III (Cash Management)

Hiring Salary Range: $86,000-$116,000

Financial Analyst II (Cash Management)

Hiring Salary Range: $78,000-$105,000

Financial Analyst I (Cash Management)

Hiring Salary Range: $65,000-$88,000

Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary outside of the posted hiring salary range based upon work experience, education and/or skill level.


Detailed Description


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Primarily responsible for maintaining daily cash transactions in treasury workstation and bank specific systems, which includes determining the daily cash requirements, including the amount of investment or borrowing required to maintain a minimal positive daily cash position for all bank accounts - in all cases meeting daily intraday cutoff times.
Reconcile current and prior day banking activity and resolve any variances immediately including reporting of any fraud to appropriate contacts as soon as possible.
Interface daily with bank fraud prevention systems to review and research exceptions as needed to make all decisions before intraday cutoff times.
Assist in developing and maintaining positive and beneficial relationships with banks, brokerage houses and other service providers as appropriate to resolve problems and support cash management and investment activities.
Assist with maintaining member prepayment database.
Assist in the monthly preparation of internal financial reports as well as quarterly and annual reports.
Maintain economic and statistical information and produce investment and other related reports, as needed.
Assist in cash management budget and ongoing working forecast including interest income, other non-operating income and investment projections.
Maintain ongoing updates from cash budgeting system into treasury workstation to maintain substantially similar forecasts in both systems for a rolling 20 months.
Maintain interfaces between treasury workstation, bank, Tri-State general ledger, Tri-State accounts payable and any additional interfaces as may arise.
Analyze cash requirements to plan short-term and long-term financial strategies including compliance with Tri-State investment policy.
Develop and maintain processes and procedures for cash management and investment systems to maximize efficiency of cash management.
Assist Accounts Payable group with check clear inquiries and stop payment issues as needed.
Create and issue various Trustee Directive instructions on monthly payment requirements.
Calculate payment due from affiliates related to Bank Fee Analysis charges and manages other Trustee related service fees and reporting in a timely manner.
Assist with internal and external audit procedures.
Prepare reporting information for Rural Utilities Services (RUS), banks, and other financial institutions.
Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures and attain knowledge and remain knowledgeable of regulations, laws, standards, and best practices applicable to functional area.
Because Tri-State has an obligation to provide continuous, reliable electric service to its customers, the ability to work overtime at any time of the day or week is considered an essential function of the job.

OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform other related duties as assigned

SUCCESS FACTORS/JOB COMPETENCIES:

Planning: ability to think ahead and plan within timelines and resources; develop scopes, plan and schedule work; set priorities and goals; anticipate and adjust for problems; evaluate workloads; measure and evaluate performance against established goals.
Time management: ability to successfully plan and implement objectives within established timelines and work schedules.
Ability to analyze problems and develop effective solutions at both strategic and functional levels.
Demonstrate behavior consistent with company values.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong team player: accomplishes tasks by working with others and being a good team player. Recognizes how his/her decisions may impact others; seeks input from others.
Computer proficiency in operating a personal computer and standard business office applications including Microsoft Office suite, databases, and other related applications.
Ability to work independently, with minimal direction as a highly motivated self-starter.

REQUIRED JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Training

BS/BA Accounting or Finance or an equivalent combination of experience and/or education.

Knowledge, Skills, and Ability:

Working knowledge of banking systems to include payment types, fraud prevention tools, and daily cutoff times.
Working knowledge of automated treasury systems and ability to assist in their development, implementation, and ongoing use and maintenance.
Working knowledge of statistical and financial analysis techniques.
Working knowledge of accounting methods and procedures.
General knowledge of money markets and the effect of economic conditions on markets.
Working knowledge of databases, database management, and creating reports from a database.
Working knowledge of PC's with a demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft office applications products.
Ability to meet daily inflexible cutoff times while maintaining a high degree of accuracy.
Ability to create processes which can be efficiently maintained either automatically or via good documentation and communication skills across entire Cash Group assuring ongoing continuity.
Continuously monitor the cash management process for ways to streamline the movement of cash and the related information.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Working knowledge of automated treasury systems and ability to assist in their development and implementation.

Experience:

Five (5) to eight (8) years of cash management and/or financial analysis experience.

Note:The above requirements describe the experience and education qualifications for the Financial Analyst III (Cash Management). Those with less experience will be hired at the I or II job grade level.

Other:

Must be able to demonstrate that he/she can perform all essential functions of the position.
Willingness to travel to attend meetings, training and conferences. (Must possess a valid driver's license.)

DESIRED JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Certified Treasury Professional (CTP designation)
Oracle 11i and Oracle Cloud experience desired
Knowledge of electric utility accounting desired

PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DEMANDS: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Physical demands: While performing the duties of this position, the incumbent is required to sit for long periods of time and occasionally stand, walk, stoop, bend, reach above and below shoulder level and push/pull objects of varying weights, and lift up to twenty-five pounds. Incumbent is frequently required to use hands and fingers to handle, or feel objects, or controls, talk and hear.

Mental demands: While performing the duties of this job, the incumbent is required to read, write, perform basic math, analyze data and reports, exercise judgment, develop plans, procedures and goals, and present information to others and work under pressure.

Work Environment: While performing the duties of this position, the incumbent is exposed to a moderate level of noise. All of the duties are performed indoors and at a desk, operating office equipment.

Job Title: Data Analytics Sales Specialist, Google Public Sector
Job Description:
Note: Google’s hybrid workplace includes remote roles.

Remote location: Colorado, USA.

8 years of experience in promoting data analytics software or solutions.

Experience in executive-level sales or consulting in cloud based (e.g., SaaS) technologies to State and Local Government and Higher Education.


Preferred qualifications:

About the job

Google Public Sector brings the magic of Google to the mission of government and education with solutions purpose-built for enterprises. We focus on helping United States public sector institutions accelerate their digital transformations, and we continue to make significant investments and grow our team to meet the complex needs of local, state and federal government and educational institutions.

Job Title: Analyst IV - (Hybrid) - Division of Youth Services Data management & Analysis Unit - Denver
Job Description:
Department Information






This position is open to current Colorado residents only.

Please note: This recruitment may be used to fill multiple vacancies.


Most State of Colorado employees are eligible for a great benefit package! Please see the Supplemental Information section below for details!


About the Division of Youth Services: The Division of Youth Services (DYS) provides a continuum of residential and non-residential services that encompass juvenile detention, commitment, and parole. DYS is the agency statutorily mandated to provide for the care and supervision of youth committed by the District Court to the custody of the Colorado Department of Human Services. The Division operates fifteen secure facilities that serve youth between the ages of 10 and 21, who are pre-adjudicated, sentenced, or committed. The Division also contracts with numerous private residential and non-residential service providers throughout the State. For pre-adjudicated youth, the Division is also responsible for the management and oversight of Colorado Youth Detention Continuum, a State-funded, locally administered program that provides services to youth at risk of further progressing into the juvenile justice system. In addition to residential programming, the Division administers juvenile parole services throughout the State.

We invite you to explore the DYS website and learn about the services provided to youth, families, and local communities in the State of Colorado at: https://www.colorado.gov/cdhs/dys

My Why


Opt in below to receive text message updates on CDHS recruiting events!


CDHSCareers



Description of Job






Overall function of the work unit:



The Division of Youth Services (DYS) Data Management and Analysis members use expertise in data, statistics, analysis, research, evaluation, criminology/sociology/psychology, as well as juvenile justice theory and literature to provide information, guide decision-making, influence policy, advocate for practices that ensure youth and family success, and enhance performance within the Division by: 1) Promoting Data-Driven Decision Making, 2) Promoting Data Transparency and Accessibility, 3) Conducting Policy/Practice-Relevant Analysis, 4) Evaluating Current Practices, and 5) Advocating for Evidence Based Principles, Practices, and Programs.

The Data Management and Analysis (DMA) team is comprised of a team of analysts with expertise in data (mining, conversion, manipulation, mapping, modeling, visualization), statistics, policy analysis, evaluation, juvenile justice, criminology/sociology/psychology, evidence based practices/programs/principals, and data systems. The core responsibilities of the Data Management and Analysis team include:

Extracting, cleaning, and validating data for analysis
Producing and distributing weekly, monthly, quarterly, bi-annual, and annual reports
Providing data in response to inquiries from: Department/Office/Division leadership, regional staff, program/facility providers, legislature, state/federal agencies, media, and other entities.
Provide leadership with the data needed to prepare for JBC briefings and hearings, figure-setting, and the submission of various decision items, budget requests, etc.
Conducting statistical analyses (utilizing SPSS, Excel, Crystal Reports, Tableau, TOAD, and TRAILS extracts)
Visualizing data by creating and maintaining dashboards using Tableau
Anticipating requests and proactively addressing questions
Communicating the results, outcomes, and implications of analyses
Developing and monitoring Division performance measures
Ensuring data integrity and quality control
Assisting in improving current methods of data collection and correction
Evaluating DYS initiatives and programs
Assisting with, reviewing, and overseeing contracted/outside evaluations
Developing formal presentation materials; presenting outcomes/findings
Promoting data-driven decision making
Advocating for data transparency, consistency, and accessibility
Advocating for evidence-based practices/programs/principles

The Data Management and Analysis team provides information to the Division’s Leadership Teams (ELT/LT), Senior Leadership Group (SLG), and numerous State and Federal authorities to assure compliance with the mandated roles of the DYS. This includes preparing appropriate Requests for Information (RFI) reports, assisting with budget requests, decision items, policy impact analyses, compiling responses/potential impact in regard to proposed bills/legislation, recommending policy and practice changes, direct involvement in the preparation of ad-hoc (and often urgent) Legislative requests, Media requests, CORA (Colorado Open Records Act) requests, and OSA (Office of the State Auditor) requests. The team is also involved in the strategic planning to meet new reporting requirements mandated in law/statute, implementing statewide initiatives (e.g., Sanctuary), promoting effective communication strategies, participating in the “Change Management” process, as well as informing the public policy process for the juvenile justice system in Colorado.


Description of Position:


This position is a Staff Authority on Allocation Models and Population Projections/Forecasting Models. These complex models direct the Department in distributing a finite amount of resources across the state (allocation models) and make data-informed decisions as it relates to budget, contracting, capital construction, and informing the legislative process (projection/forecasting models).


In addition, this position is responsible for initiating, designing and generating statistical analyses, reports and special studies that meet the reporting commitments of the Division, to the Office, Department, state and federal government; projects that are of high interest to DYS leadership, state and local agencies/governments, consultants, and the general public. Main duties include but are not limited to: cleaning, correcting, and maintaining data extracted from TRAILS for use by the DMA team for analyses using SPSS; conducting monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting on juvenile justice populations using data collected by the Division; independently developing original and valid statistical models; performing statistical analysis, interpretation, visualization, and research using SPSS and Tableau; editing data and independently investigating anomalies to ensure data integrity; and publishing various statutory and ad hoc reports. Duties also include advising users (federal, state, and local officials, etc.) on the interpretation of information presented, providing statistical analysis in support of the Division and their clients/staff by analyzing the potential impact of programs, policies, approaches, etc. The position provides in -depth answers to questions concerning the interpretation of data and the associated analysis


Data Analyst/Statistical Analyst

This position is the Division’s Staff Authority on Allocation and Projection Models. This position generates scientifically sound, defensible, and real-time data-driven models to aid the CYDC Advisory Board (in allocating over $16 Million dollars in resources and 215 detention beds to the 22/23 Judicial Districts) and aid the Department in strategically planning for juvenile justice population volume changes at critical junctures in the detention and commitment continuums (in forecasting population figures).

This position uses appropriate scientific methods and statistical techniques using SPSS and Tableau to investigate and report on delinquency-related outcomes, risk-reduction outcomes, offender data, social indicators, program effectiveness, and service needs (resources and gaps). This position determines the appropriate data elements necessary to conduct statistically valid analyses. This position further assists in disseminating results through presentations and in writing to the legislature, governmental and non-governmental agencies, and the public.

Analyze (collect, analyze, interpret, and present) appropriate indicators and ethnographic data on juvenile delinquency-related issues in Colorado. Assume a leadership role in the development and implementation of evaluation reports required by statute, Governor Requests for Information (RFI’s) and/or requests made by other parties. This position designs and implements strategies to evaluate program, initiative, framework, approach, and strategy effectiveness, including data collection, data analyses, and report preparation. This position also coaches/trains new DMA analysts: counsel staff in the design and implementation of projects and review the accuracy and relevancy of reports submitted. In addition, this position develops and implements streamlined processes to track and analyze various Division outcomes (key outcomes and intermediate outcomes) and performance indicators (e.g.,
performance management measures, recidivism outcomes, discharge metrics, etc.).


Quality Assurance (QA) / Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI)

This position will lead efforts Division-wide to ensure data integrity (quality & accuracy) by troubleshooting data entry errors, formula or calculation errors, coding/programming/SQL errors or data abnormalities (using SPSS).

Other Duties as Assigned.




Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights

Hybrid work arrangements
Please note: These working arrangements are subject to change.


Experience and Education required.

Three (3) years of professional experience in statistical analysis, data interpretation, and/or data extraction that must include experience using SPSS, STATA, R, SQL, or similar software to analyze data and perform statistical analyses, including writing and troubleshooting complex syntax files.

~And~

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Juvenile or Criminal Justice, Criminology, Sociology, Economics, Political Science, Computer Science, Data Science/Analytics, or a closely related field.


Substitutions:

Professional work experience as outlined above, which provided the same kind, amount, and level of knowledge acquired in the required education, may be substituted on a year-for-year basis for the bachelor's degree, for a total of 7 (seven) years of experience required. Which must include experience in SPSS, STATA, R, SQL, or similar software used to analyze data and perform statistical analyses, including writing and troubleshooting complex syntax files is still required with the substitution.

A master's or doctorate degree* from an accredited college or university in Statistics, Mathematics, Juvenile or Criminal Justice, Criminology, Sociology, Economics, Political Science, Computer Science, Data Science/Analytics or a closely related field may be substituted for the bachelor's degree and one year of general experience. However, experience in SPSS, STATA, R, SQL, or similar software used to analyze data and perform statistical analyses, including writing and troubleshooting complex syntax files is still required with the substitution.


A legible copy of college or university transcripts must be submitted in order for applicants to receive credit for the education requirement.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master's Degree or Doctorate in Criminology, Criminal Justice, Sociology, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science/Analytics or Computer Science.
Three (3) years of professional experience as a statistical analyst in a Juvenile Justice program.
Advanced proficiency with SPSS, SQL, Excel, and Tableau, including writing and troubleshooting complex syntax files.
Exceptional proficiency with the following software programs/IT solutions:

Crystal Reports
Quest TOAD for Data Analysts
Colorado TRAILS data/case management system
Tableau
Oracle

Extensive experience in generating and amending data reports utilizing Crystal Reports or TOAD or SQL queries;
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills;
The ability to discern important findings/trends from an abundance of data.

Conditions of Employment:

The successful candidate in this position must be willing and available to submit to the following conditions:
Must be 21 years old or older
Must possess and maintain a valid U.S. driver's license
Must have no felony convictions and no violent history
Periodic travel to meetings, conferences, trainings, and/or alternate work sites.
Must pass a Colorado Bureau of Investigations and a Federal Bureau of Investigations background check as a condition of employment. Included in the background check is a current and/or previous employer check. Your current and/or previous employers within the past 10 years at a minimum must be listed on your job application (most recent in descending order), even if the job or duties are unrelated to the position for which you are applying. Incomplete employer information (address, phone number, and supervisor) or omission of former employers may result in a disqualification of your application.
Continued employment is contingent upon successful completion of the DYS Pre-service Training Academy, along with any mandatory annual training if required for the position.
Former State employees who were disciplinarily terminated or resigned in lieu of termination must disclose the information on the application and provide an explanation why the prior termination or resignation should not disqualify the applicant from the current position. Absent extraordinary circumstances, prior disciplinary termination or resignation in lieu of termination will disqualify the applicant from future State employment with CDHS.

Appeal Rights:

If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for this position, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board or request a review by the State Personnel Director.

An appeal or review must be submitted on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative. This form must be delivered to the State Personnel Board by email (dpa_state.personnelboard@state.co.us), postmarked in US Mail or hand delivered (1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver CO 80203), or faxed (303.866.5038) within ten (10) calendar days from your receipt of notice or acknowledgement of the department’s action.

For more information about the appeals process, the official appeal form, and how to deliver it to the State Personnel Board; go to spb.colorado.gov; contact the State Personnel Board for assistance at (303) 866-3300; or refer to 4 Colorado Code of Regulations (CCR) 801-1, State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, Chapter 8, Resolution of Appeals and Disputes, at spb.colorado.gov under Rules.
